description:
I really liked the vibe here. You order before finding a seat and you should be able to find one by the time you order. The layout is pretty cool with some tables inside (small section upstairs and a couple on the ground floor) that seem pretty nice to chill and do work at. There's also a bunch of seating outside to enjoy with your four legged friend. 
 The eggs were pretty fluffy and if you ask for a bagel with just eggs and cream cheese in it, then they give you A LOT of eggs - overflows and drapes over the bagel like a dress.  
Heads up, the large yogurt bowl is pretty big with tons of fruit and good for like 2 people. 
Lox bagel is filled with a lot of smoked salmon and the breakfast burrito is stuffed with eggs - satisfying breafast.  I wouldn't say the food stood out to me that much. Dont get me wrong though. It was solid, good food with great presentation, and I really enjoyed it, but there wasn't anything especially unique. The service was pretty good too. I'd definitely come back here because overall it was a good experience.
author: Rachelle C.

description:
Nice dog-friendly cafe for working and getting brunch on weekends. Make sure you charge your laptops if you are going to use one here since they don't have outlet as far as I have noticed. 

I love their airy interior and friendly staff. Expect a line, but the line moves very fast and finding a place to sit is never an issue here. I got lox bagel and bowl of fruit here. The lox bagel is really yummy.
author: Jessie L.

description:
What a nice find in the Mission, and I don't think if has anything to do with horses. There were no photos of Seabiscuit or Mr. Ed on the walls. The name could refer to the mental state of the customers who linger here as it's a becalming spot that doesn't induce fits of hysteria unless we all start talking about the current political landscape. Actually I found out later that the building was once a carriage house so now I get it. I came in here thinking I could get a light breakfast after my gym workout, and I was right as they have quite a menu of creative-sounding global dishes made with fresh, organic ingredients.

I had every intention of choosing between the yogurt with granola or the hot oats, but what appealed to me in the moment was the $6 Piaf, which was a roasted tomato topped with scrambled eggs and slices of brie (photo: http://bit.ly/2wrVssH). With a good dousing of hot sauce, it was a light, delicious treat since it had been a while since I had eaten eggs. I added a satisfying $3.50 Four Barrel Cafe au Lait to complete the meal (photo: http://bit.ly/2Bz0glH). I liked the vibe so much I came back a few weeks later to have the same Cafe au Lait out on their enclosed terrace which serves as a community space (photo: http://bit.ly/2wjJFfI). This space must have been where the horses ate their oats. Tap your hoof once for yes and twice for no.

FOOD - 4 stars...light and fluffy eggs with Four Barrel provided a pleasing morning blend
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...very chill, especially in the terrace on a nice day
SERVICE - 4 stars...even-keeled with none of that Tartine 'tude
TOTAL - 4 stars...are you stable enough for the Stable?

RELATED - Looking for some breakfast? Here's a list of places I've tried and reviewed: http://bit.ly/2At2LFz
author: Ed U.

description: Such a cool spot to hangout for breakfast/brunch on a sunny day! The food and coffee is average by SF standards but the space is just gorgeous with great backyard feels! Must go on a sunny day!
author: Nidhi M.

description: This place has the most beautiful outdoor garden to sit in. It doesn't seem to get much sun, but on a nice day it is a truly lovely experience!
author: Dana O.

description:
Whenever I go to a place like Stable Cafe, it reminds me that I should get out more often. There are so many hidden gems in San Francisco like this one... I'm a sucker for gorgeous and serene outdoor patios. I ordered coffee and food at the front cash register. There were salads and sandwiches galore on the menu, but the special said TACOS. How could I resist? They sounded amazing.

I took my number and entered the not-so-secret garden. I found two seats since I was meeting my friend and broke out my laptop to get some work done. It was hard to concentrate, being around so many people and beautiful succulents. I typically work from home, so this was a special treat. I also realized that I totally could have brought my dog here. There was even a water bowl, the universal signal for pet-friendliness. 

The shredded beef tacos were amazing. I don't remember what other ingredients there were, but the flavors were unique, and the amount of food was plentiful for lunch. I was in a happy place. My friend met up with me, and we had a good conversation... which worked out since WiFi was down that day. Oh well, I guess it was a sign that I needed to get out and relax for once.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Good place for simple breakfast and coffee. Both indoor and outdoor seating available. Decor outside is cute with lots of greenery. It feels like a little oasis stepping in.
We ordered the nono (tomato slices, two eggs and melted cheese on crispy baguette slices) and the avocado toast. They were good, not too filling but satisfying. Coffee was a bit acidic for me but tasted great with a splash of oat milk which the cashier/barista mentioned was all the rage right now. Other notes... Bus your own tables. $1 coffee refills. Glasses & water cooler outside for self service
author: Sarah M.

description:
My brother and sis-in-law were in town, so we went out for breakfast before they had to head out of SF. We landed at Stable Cafe. The interior is a bit cozy, but the outdoor seating is what makes this place. It's a huge space, and has tons of plants to make it feel like a secret garden. It would be perfect to eat outside on a nice day. Ordering is casual as you go up to the counter tops and place your order.

For their coffee, they use four barrel beans. I was excited for my drink and ordered a cappuccino. Honestly, wasn't very impressed with it. The coffee portion seemed a bit weak, and it wasn't as foamy as I would have liked my drink to be. For my meal, I ordered stable eggs, which came with two sunny side up eggs, baguette toast, salami, and asparagus. The food was okay, but there wasn't anything exceptional about it. The toast was probably the best part of it. 

The order comes out pretty quickly though, and the servers are helpful. Pricing is also great for SF living. I would plan breakfast better next time and try a different place. Although if you're looking for a good outdoor ambiance, then this is your place.
author: Jackie C.

description:
As a splurge, I will drop by Stable Cafe on my way to work to grab a LOX BAGEL SANDWICH. Their everything bagels have lots of flavor and good texture. There's a generous amount of lox topped with dill, capers, red onions, and a small serving of local fruit on the side. The bagels are evenly toasted to add a good amount of crunch to the sandwich. Breakfast of champions! I only wish they spread the herb cream cheese on both side of the bagels instead of just the bottom. Service is always friendly and it's fun to chat with the staff while waiting for your order. I typically get my stuff within 10 minutes of ordering and then I'm on my way to the office with my breakfast in hand! When it's warmer out I also get a WATERMELON FRESCA to go -- yummy!

I say this is a splurge because it's ~$7 for the bagel sandwich and $4-5 for beverages.
author: Bonnie Z.

description:
Praise heeeeeeem! 

Walked out of an interview feeling good, might have even skipped across the street to my Lyft. The sun bouncing off of my melanin and smile across my face, I was looking forward to finding my next destination -- a cafe with outdoor seating. Now, where I live there is no shortage of coffee shops, however most do not have an adequate outdoor space. So I hopped on the inta'net (spelling intentional) and searched for "best cafes with outdoor seating. BOOM! Stable popped up. 

The next natural thing for me to do was to look them up on yelp saw great reviews and what seemed to be a dope patio... it was dope. The food was DOPE. The people DOPE... the vibe DOPE. The WiFi dope-ish, ok actually I wouldn't know because I was told it was slow so I used my hot spot BUT besides that everything else DOPE.

I am so happy to finally have found my spot to work and enjoy the weather. I know it's going to suck the more that people find out about this place... 


Wait... never mind, this place sucked ass, don't go... don't go.
author: Alisha T.

description:
great place to get some work done. Nice music, great wifi, nice seat.
It's sad that there's no power plug to use.
Foods are good. I have "NONO" for my breakfast, which I think is pretty nice. (NONO: open-face sandwich on baguettes, tomato, provolone and two sunny side up eggs) 
Will want to come to try other dishes.
author: Wi T.

description:
I'm so mad that I only just found out about this place.  I've been twice now, and I love it.  This place has indoor (second floor and first floor) and outdoor seating.  The outdoor area is BEAUTIFUL.  It's like in between two buildings and you are surrounded by beautiful trees, plants, and flowers.  It's very instagramable.  

The food/coffee here is also wonderful.  Tastes good, and the latte art is so pretty!  I loved my vanilla almond milk latte - amazingly delicious.  Their food is plated beautifully and I honestly don't think you can go wrong with any of their options.  The staff is super patient/helpful/friendly.  

I will definitely return and have already recommended it to coworkers/friends.  Love that there's always a bunch of dogs here (in the outdoor area).
author: Michelle S.

description:
BEAUTIFUL space indoors and mainly, outdoors.

I've walked by multiple times as it's on the way to and from my yoga studio I go to on the weekends. It's always full of people enjoying their outdoor space in their back patio. They have plant arrangement classes too in the space by a local artist, which is awesome and sustainable!

We had a light breakfast which was so comfortable and peaceful outside. You order at the cashier. If the line goes out the door, don't worry...it moves fast! I had a chai and the boo had coffee. The hot drinks were the best part. The chai was definitely one of the best ones I've had ever in the city, foamy, flavorful, but not gritty or overly sweet. I enjoyed the manchego and fig scone. Their baked pastries seem to be the best items. We also had their quiche and scrambled eggs. The eggs were way overdone, like cooked hard. The quiche has meat in it. Boo liked it, and said that the orange sauce it came with was delicious. We agreed that the breakfast was just alright, but the drinks were our favorite part.

There is serve-yourself water and a buss-your-own-table-system. Service is very kind and nice, and the server is WERK'in while he brings you your food items. STRUT it hunni. We loved the atmosphere and the calm serenity it brought early in the morning. Great space indoors too, with two levels--perfect for people-watching. Will come back for to-go pastries and a hot drink.
author: Jodi H.

description:
This review is for Stable Cafe as a wedding venue only.

We worked with Minah who was super helpful and responsive through the entire process. She tried to be flexible where possible, allowing us to drop off some deliveries earlier than planned to avoid traffic mishaps. She answered all emails quickly.

Our other vendors enjoyed working with her as well and her team was also efficient on the day of.

The space is just beautiful for an intimate garden wedding, full of green trees and artfully arranged wall and floor planters.  It's not exactly cheap to rent, but cheaper than what you pay at a traditional SF wedding venue.

PRO TIP: If you end up using the space, I would encourage you to measure carefully in person to account for the many gorgeous planters that are not included in the venue layout map.
author: Josie M.

description:
SF, you are #patiogoals. So many pretty spots to sit outside and watch the fog burn off. So many plants. So many vibes. Knowing my love for the aforementioned patios, plants, and vibes, a friend took me to Stable to grab some breakfast and get some work done. This spot is right up my alley--I honestly could've sat there all day, ordering multiple rounds of coffee and toast and testing out different corners of the coffee shop and patio. 

This cafe has some nice breakfast-y options--mostly things on good, crusty bread. I ordered a cup of coffee and an avocado toast. Now, there are lots of ways you can avo toast--you can smash it or mash it, slice it. top it with lemon...don't even get me started on salts. Stable slices their avocado and tops that with a hard boiled egg--while I'd personally prefer a soft boiled egg and mashed avocado, this was pretty bomb. We ate out on the patio, which was a total dream. There was even a little wood burning stove in the back surrounded by the prettiest plants--not sure what they use it for, but it was gorgeous.

The servers here are a hoot and were so kind. They have a few beer and wine options if you want to sit and stay awhile, plus a dessert or two to satisfy your sweet tooth. I'd most definitely come back here--actually, can I just move in?
author: Megan R.

description: They have a really cool patio to sit and chill. Love their Banana Nutella sendvich.
author: Alice S.

description:
This is the type of place that I don't want to write a good review about because I don't want people to know about it. 

Although the location is kind of an odd place between the Mission, Potrero and SoMa, I almost like that it's a bit isolated because it is quieter. 

The patio is spacious and even on a drizzly cloudy day, it was open, which made me happy! Even though it was A bit chilly outside I want myself up with a warm chai tea latte and hot oats with fruit which I highly recommend (they taste better than they sound). 

Since my impatient ass did not want to wait for food I also opted for a little superfood multigrain cookie. I'm not sure what it is called exactly and it definitely looked overpriced but when I took a bite of it, it all made sense. It's at the front near the register so if it's there I would give it a try!

If I ever have some sort of party or reception, I would definitely consider renting out this space. It's so charming and feels not city-like, which is the type of escape I need every now and then.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Wow this place is a veritable oasis in gritty Mission.  Stepping into the outdoor patio, you are welcomed with a peaceful verdant setup with lots of tables and chairs. It was not busy on a Sunday morning.  Maybe because it was pretty early (10am) and very foggy/chilly.  I highly recommend the chilaquilles-so good with bonus bacon on top!
author: Helen H.

description:
Absolutely delightful cafe. The cafe itself is lovely, with a loft overlooking the small indoor space, and a large outdoor patio that is beautifully landscaped. So serene. 

The menu is a pleasant mix of sandwiches and savory items, with plenty of options to satisfy folks looking for healthy and/or keto options, or just darn good dishes. I especially love that you can sides of meat or avocado or veggies to anything. The food is simple, but very high quality, and full of flavor. Not to mention that the menu is insanely priced in the wallet friendly direction. I don't understand how the food can be this good at this price in San Francisco. The portions were perfect. Not overwhelming large like most breakfast joints. We were satisfied but not stuffed when we left. 

The drinks menu features a full coffee bar, plus beer and wine. The staff when we were there were all exceptionally nice. All a little quirky, but it was such a welcome change to visit a SF restaurant where the staff weren't exuding hate / pretentiousness. 

This place is a true gem. I wished I lived in the city so that I could come here to work or read on the patio. I will definitely be back. Everything about this place was a delight.
author: Mandie H.

description:
Came to this cute cafe for a last-minute brunch right before I had to leave for the airport.

Food: good, but nothing spectacular. We got the Stable Eggs and Pomba. I really like the idea of local, farm-fresh ingredients, but the Pomba was just too heavy for me (the brie gelled up in the cold weather rather quickly), and the Stable Eggs was something I could've easily assembled at home, not seasoned particularly well.

Service: Nothing to complain about, it's a quick line up to the register where you order and pay, and then you seat yourself with your number and the server brings the food to your table. My encounter with the cashier was pleasant, and he entertained me and my friends' fight to grab the check (obviously it's my turn to pay, Brian).

Ambiance: I actually loved the ambiance, and this totally made the brunch so much more fun. We explored the back (they were having some sort of cheese-centric cooking class?) and found a variety of plants and cookbooks for sale. Such a cute and wild piece of jungle in the middle of the city.

Overall, I think I'd come back here if I needed to stop by for a quick bite and didn't want to wait in 3-hour SF brunch lines. The prices are super reasonable and the ambiance is cute. I'll try to come back in warmer weather!
author: Kelley L.

description:
One of my favorite SF establishments. The garden patio is incredibly serene and beautiful- a nice contrast to the busy, dirty streets out front. The Chai is amazing, and the gluten free options are both plentiful, and tasty.  The only issue I've ever encountered is that they're not always open, so you should call ahead to confirm sure before making the trek over.

Also, we love this place so much, my (now) fiance proposed to me here, in the back event area.  It's a great venue for private parties, and I am told the staff was great to work with.  I can't imagine a more perfect setting!
author: Laura S.

description: This is the perfect event space! Stable Cafe hosted our wedding and it couldn't have been a better setting for our magical, whimsical garden wedding. Our guests were all so impressed.  This beautiful tree lined courtyard is the ideal venue for an intimate wedding or party!
author: ashley j.

description:
Heading out of San Fran! 

Ordered: almond milk chai, iced vanilla latte 

Pros: this place is set in a unique structure that actually was a stable. I love the decor in and out, their patio is amazing! It's large with many table, plants and lights. The service was friendly and quick. It was in a fun part of town.

Cons: I did not enjoy the chai, it is very very spiced and I like mine sweet. I didn't enjoy it so I ordered another drink.
author: Ceci F.

description: Superrrr cute restaurant with the nicest (shaded) outdoor patio and stellar coffee and avocado toast. However, do not make the mistake of order eggs here. I ordered the Pliaf (scrambled eggs on Brie and tomato) and they straight up served me an omelette and said it was their version of scrambled eggs - kind of disappointing but cute atmosphere and only $6. They also don't have ANY wall outlets to charge your computer so if you plan to work here - make sure you're all juiced up.
author: Sam M.

description: This really was a hidden gem. The food was quite heavy but looked beautiful and was delicious! Definitely come hungry. The patio outside is GORGEOUS and I would go again just to sit out there and sip on coffee, admiring the beautiful garden and quaint atmosphere.
author: Madeline C.

description: Lovely little well-lit cafe and lunch spot in a converted, turn-of-the-century stable, just around the corner from my SF office, that came highly-recommended by a runner friend. Excellent coffee drinks (with some interesting yet non-foufy offerings, like a Cordero), and where else can you get avocado toast for a mere five dollars? And with a hard-boiled egg, no less?!?
author: Kim S.

description:
It's all about the patio here which is a beautiful oasis of tranquility and style in this random location in the industrial part of the Mission.  Whoever designed this place put a lot of thought into the details of the patio and cafe which is located in an old carriage house. 

I go for their Avocado Toast, nutella toast, or any of their paninis which come with salad (asparagus/goat cheese is the best). 
.
It's just a cool place to go with a hip, tech professional vibe that's not  pretentious.
author: Joan W.

description: Waiting at the bar today, no greeting. Ask the barista if he could ring me up and he had an attitude. And asked me if I can't cash to pay. He was rude and condescending.
author: Tyne J.

description:
The outdoor patio is literally a coffee sanctuary. Imagine sipping on a latte surrounded by succulents and not hearing honking horns (ok, maybe there will be some honking horns). 

The food menu offers creative & quick options that are good for breakfast and brunch. Portions are on the smaller side.

Passes the "Would I take my mom there?" Test!
author: Karis O.

description: Great place for brunch or coffee. Beautiful outside sitting area under the trees. Good coffee. Delicious sandwiches.
author: Sameet M.

description:
The best part of this place is the outdoor seating that is relaxing and not congested. 
The food is also delicious.
author: Frederic A.

description: I would say the food was delicious and the coffee was great but when the help isn't so friendly, the quality gets ruined. The experience before was pleasant enough for me to return for a third time but the help was always a little on edge when I ordered. When I paid and the cashier returned my card, I said politely, "Thank you sir." He responded by saying it was rude I use that term on him and that I should listen more. I said I was sorry but it was a phrase I use as respect for other males. He was noticeably pissed and no longer cheery. He should see that I was not like the others and shouldn't have singled me out and make me feel uncomfortable. The food was made quickly and was really good but the interaction for me being genuinely sincere and polite like I was taught, was as rude as it can be. It ruined this place for me, because the atmosphere was peaceful and nice. Food 4 stars, customer service 1 star.
author: Javier F.

description: Not a lot of seating available but the Brie toast was delish. Vanilla latte didn't taste much of a vanilla latte. Customer service was really nice! Busy on a Sunday morning brunch. Outside seating available with lots of space.
author: Yana P.

description:
Although our mochas varied in size and shape I can't wait to come back. Everyone who works here is beautiful and friendly. All the items on the menu are relatively cheap and always satisfying. 

The succulents in the garden sing to you after every warm sip of coffee. I love you stable.
author: Storm S.

description:
Review on booking the space for an event (did not eat from the menu!)

Did not eat here, although the menu looks yummy. I'm here to review the venue itself! The venue is beautiful, especially the outside area. There is a gorgeous little patio with string lights and benches and tables and chairs as well as a brick oven great for making focaccia or pizza. the ambience is so nice and they have heating lamps for the evenings. I would highly recommend hosting an event here!
author: Sela B.

description:
This place is super cute, definitely a hidden gem on an otherwise nondescript block. 

Their food is good, but the space is very limited. They have plenty of patio tables, but on a cold January Saturday afternoon, we wanted to be inside. Luckily a small table opened up after we hovered for a while, but otherwise most tables were occupied by people drinking coffee and working on their laptops. 

Their food wasn't amazing. See my photos for additional details!
author: Ziyan C.

description: I got the vanilla latte and avocado toast. Honestly wasn't the best... The setting was better than the food and coffee...
author: Alison L.

description:
I visited here today with my two dogs. Outdoor seating is cute and spacious, but a bit too cold to stay for a hot drink even sunny day in SF early March. We waited for a while for two drinks - a london fog and an espresso - and it made us even more cold outside. Well, it was fine, sometimes it takes time for many reasons - many customers, short staff, etc. 

My London fog was lukewarm and blend :( it was disappointing for the price and wait time. I had once a breakfast here and it was similar experience. I might not go back for food or drinks here.
author: Roy S.

description:
Perfect brunch with the housemates! Loved it. 
Backyard is peaceful with fresh green trees. Clean and poised environment.
author: Bhargav S.

description: Great service. Delicious food! The wait wasn't too long and the atmosphere was fun and wholesome. Loved how the menu had so much to pick from. Will definitely come again!
author: Aman K.

description:
Great little cafe hidden on the backstreets off Mission. This place has a beautiful little venue, complete with a second floor, a handful of options for seating and an awesome outdoor patio. Great for a cappuccino and an egg muffin with ham (so good! and affordable, thank goodness) on the weekends, I typically only stop in for pick up but would definitely come here on a lazy day to get my coffee fix, hang out with some friends, and maybe try their brunch at some point!

Get there early, it gets crowded pretty quick and definitely expect to wait in line! Also, breakfast ends at right at 2pm and you cannot get an egg sandwich after 2pm as I experienced one very sad sunday.....
author: Nerissa C.

description:
What a cool spot! Came around 11am with a friend, and we had such a great time. The food was terrific, the coffee was fantastic, and the staff was super friendly!

The real gem, however, is the outdoor part of the cafe with the garden seating. It's a really neat spot, and it's perfect for catching up with a friend over a coffee or tea. You've got to check it out!

This is such a nice cafe - will definitely be back.
author: Brian M.

description: Nice and cozy place. Ordered panini and avocado toast - it's fresh and tasty. Best cappuccino I tried in San Francisco
author: Konstantin R.

description: Omg a hidden treasure off of Mission! I found this cafe close to work. The pastries are fresh and they have gluten free options well. A little pricey but when I'm handed a croissant still warm from the oven it's worth every penny. Amazing outdoor patio to sit and daydream for hours...
author: Evelyn S.

description:
The outdoor cafe is filled with trees and succulents. I'm surprised such a nice open space exists in the Mission. Definitely a good place to chat or get some work done. Mix of both crowds during a weekday afternoon. 

The veggie sandwich is tasty and has good ingredients. For $10, a side salad was also included. This place serves standard breakfast and lunch fare. 

Wi-Fi is a bit spotty though.

Basically, I come here for the green atmosphere.
author: Joanna L.

description:
(04/23/17) Really cool place with awesome outdoor seating. Inside seating is pretty limited. As for the food, meh. The NONO open face sandwich was a no-no for me. Nothing special and the flavor was lacking. It wasn't appealing to the eyes especially with the provolone melted on top of the eggs making them look more pale and sad. The toast was difficult to cut thru, even adding bacon couldn't save the meal for me. My gf said the chilaquiles were okay but also felt nothing special to them. Almost $30 for both dishes and an OJ was definitely not worth it! 

3 stars for the atmosphere and good service we received when placing our order. I would come back only to get coffee and sit outside on a nice sunny day. I'll stay away from the food or maybe go with something simple/cheap like the avocado toast.
author: D B.

description: We held our private ceremony at Stable Cafe this past weekend and it was so lovely! Minah & her staff were so kind, and Minah herself worked with us from the beginning to bring our vision to life. She was proactive in helping us find a solution with the rain and allowed us to make the space our own (even with a small group!). Thank you again!
author: Darcy Y.

description: Outdoor space is freaking adorable, food is BOMB (I got the veggie sandwich with added chicken mmmmm), the staff is super friendly, a little over priced and I wish it was in a better neighborhood but whatevs. Free Wifi makes up for it.
author: Leah M.

description: That patio does it for me  such a serenity, never too crowded or loud but definitely appreciated by those are there. I usually get the cold brew coffee which is a solid choice for caffeine but portion sizes run a bit small in my opinion. Excited to try some other menu items. The employees are interesting and kind as well!
author: Katy S.

description:
Stable Café is a really cool laid back spot to get some breakfast bites and a coffee.

The people working behind the counter were very friendly and personable. They had strong relationships with some of the regulars and even cooed a baby.

I had the wrap, a few mimosas, and some fruit. Everything tasted great and fresh. There is an indoor area where you order with some seating available, but the mainstay is the outdoor space just to the right. Secluded and coy, this space was relaxing for a quick early morning breakfast. Come here to enjoy your coffee, bring the kids and the dog, or laptop up in the shade of plum trees. There were many different seating arrangements for couples to community seating. Pick your spot, your preference of sun or shade, and adjust as you so please.
author: Rawlins R.

description:
C'mon you guys, that egg sandwich is a joke. Bread so thick and dry it was unchewable even without the thick encrustment of white flour -- and you couldn't even toast it for 9 bucks? 

2 stars for the sandwich and 1 star for the dark, depressing trap music which is totally discordant in the business meeting atmosphere.
author: Zach B.

description: I really been digging this place lately. I came here several years ago I guess around the time it first opened and it always seemed crowded and the menu seemed limited. But maybe it's changed or I've change or maybe it's the fact that I only come here Fridays now, and it's not crowded, but the staff is delightful, the food is really good, and there's no better outdoor place in San Francisco that I know of to just hang out and linger than the courtyard at stable.
author: Mark M.

description:
The patio is beautiful - a unique oasis in the Mission.  While I had a lackluster experience food and service-wise, if you're looking for a green getaway, the setting makes a visit worth it.  

I got the Pomba, which turned out about the same as the Egg-In-A-Hole I made in 7th grade Home Economics class.  Toast was too thick and underdone.  Eggs were overdone and chewy.  Bacon was perfectly done so that was nice.  Blackberries were a nice touch.  It'd be great if they carried a hot sauce other than Tapatillo.  

The staff are typical trendier-than-thou servers who seemingly were never taught basic manners.  I worked in the retail and service industries for more than fifteen years and I know how much it can suck, but it's your job to be decent to people.
author: Sarah R.

description: Everything here tastes good. Some days all I crave is their tomato soup. Which usually is sold out by the time o get there. Not their fault. Grilled asparagus panini with goat cheese? Oh yeah. Quinoa salad is fab. Outdoor setting is so lovely that the fact that their coffee is a bit bitter for my taste doesn't stop me from making this a go to fave.
author: S Blair P.

description: Such a great place! Quality food and totally reasonable prices. Oats were on point and so was ago toast. Wish I had room to try more. See pics!
author: Maria O.

description:
Honestly, the food and coffee is a bit below mediocre. I mean, it gets the job done but I wouldn't make this place a destination.

I keep coming back because it's a nice spot to catch up with my girlfriends after yoga, and it's way less crowded than Tartine. 

The space outside is BEAUTIFUL, like you're in a garden. It can get a little crowded but just be an adult ask for people to move their shit over.
author: Susy C.

description:
Great ambiance and food was tasty. The garden seating is lovely!  BUT this is the epitome of hipster nation gone awry. The staff was pretentious and when I said "thanks!" The reply was, "no problem", as if THEY were doing me a favor! And, when I was waiting to ring up, staff were talking amongst themselves as if I weren't even there. There was no indication the staff at the counter had customer service skills. 

No matter how "cool" your place is, customers keep it in business, so it would be great to feel more appreciated as a customer.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
I love everything about this Cafe! The vibe (relaxing, Succulents, outdoor Patio, trees), the coffee (even got a free coffee from the Barista), the food (simple yet filling) and the price (for SF, this place is a steal).

I was here last Saturday and here I am Monday after thinking of my Brunch experience here!
author: Liberty A.

description:
Ambiance: super cute cafe with plenty of outdoor seating and wifi! NOTE: no outlets available anywhere! Good music as well which is always a plus :)
Food: Avocado toast was an affordable $5 but you get what you pay for. Basically just wheat toast, sliced avocado with salt and peppers and a hardboiled egg. I had a sample of their pastry and I think next time I'll go for the pastries instead - very flavorful and sweet!
author: Taryn Q.

description: WiFi consistently NOT WORKING. password not accepted staff snotty about it. Just power off then on and everyone would've good. Instead they have an attitude. Not fun. Other than that fabulous
author: Joe M.

description: Any place that has a huge outdoor beautifully planted space is a win, but on top of that the food and drinks are delicious. The servers are friendly and fast and just chatty enough to make you feel welcome, plus they allow dogs! Enjoy your coffee with people and puppy watching.
author: Aili P.

description: The patio is pretty, but cold, even on the warmest SF days and I run hot personally. The food is good but nothing remarkable, and not really worth the long lines. The worst part is that the waitstaff is snotty and rude. Not warm and inviting at all, they just make you feel like they don't want you there. Maybe it's different during slow times or during the week, but there's no reason to have an attitude with customers just because you're busy. The person that took my order was cold, the barista was rude, and the food runner flat out insulted me (he approached me with a plate that wasn't mine, and when I said politely that it's not my order he returned later to tell me that it was my order, just one plate was off, insinuating that I somehow should have known that). Save your money and go somewhere that actually wants to serve you.
author: Peter I.

description: I planned a get together to meet at Stable Cafe this past Saturday but when I got there they were closed. There was an event going on which was not posted on their website. I specifically checked their website a few days prior to see if there would be any closures due to events. NOPE. Quite a few other patrons came by and had to leave as well. I understand that this space is often rented out for events but please post something on your website to let everyone else know. I know our business isn't comparable to your events but an FYI on your website would've been nice. My advice, CALL them the day of before trekking over.
author: Yuxuan N.

description:
Stable Cafe is great. It's in a part of town that is in the throes of gentrification. As a result, the street is kind of iffy, but the second you get inside, the cafe is well tended, beautiful, and airy. It seems like a mini-oasis/garden, which you never want to leave. The patrons seem to feel the same way, comfortably lounging around and chatting. The menu is small but fulfilling. I recommend the latte and the melt.

Adding the smiley face coffee :)
author: Marina P.

description:
I would come here if in the area given the adorable succulent garden, outdoor seating area, and free plums; however, I wouldn't make a special trip for this.

The food and coffee are, like the 3-star Yelp category, A-OK.  I didn't get the right breakfast sandwich to go, but it was fine.  The bread was under toasted and little tough/chewy to rip through.  My almond milk latte was good.

The interior is nice and fairly quiet on days when the weather is nice and people can enjoy the patio.  They have a sweet collection of local artwork that I very much enjoyed.

The outdoor space is beautiful - the neighborhood is really quiet, so you can actually relax outside without traffic and chaos around you.  Their many plum trees are so nice to have and you can actually eat the fruit - my understanding is that you can pick from the trees (within reason, not to fill a bag...just for you to eat), and then there's also usually a bucket of ripe plums that have already fallen or been picked for the taking.

Cute spot - if I lived closer, I could see myself visiting often on the weekends to unwind.
author: Tay H.

description: Love stable cafe. Great food, great atmosphere. Wonderful outside seating area. The iced coffee is fire, though, so be careful.
author: Aaron A.

description: They are very polite and their short but well put together menu is our new favorite. They make very nice coffee. We will be going often
author: Robert B.

description:
Breath of fresh air! Great patio and event space. Like a hidden gem with bricks laid down during the gold rush. 

Vibrant staff. Friendly. And very dog friendly.

Food looks great. Being a low carb person I appreciated and enjoyed the frittata with the killer sauce.

Certainly go back and will make it a hang out spot with friends. Nice to see gay men.... they are hard to find these days.

Must visit place.
author: Janis C.

description: Love this cafe. Found it one day while walking to a bicycle coalition event. The garden seating is tranquil, the food and tea delicious and the service is wonderful. One of my favorite spots in SF!
author: Allison M.

description:
3.5 stars
Very cute cafe. We had just finished trying on some clothes at Everlane down the street and stumbled upon this place. 

Great lunch menu choices, paninis, sandwiches and salads. Unfortunately, they ran out of the quinoa salad so we shared a chicken sandwich. Also picked up a decent sauv blanc here.

The atmosphere is a 5! Great little private patio out back. Nice, quiet seating inside. Clean bathrooms, lots of nice succulents to set the mood. Service was very friendly and quick. Food was very average. Would love to come back one morning and try some of their coffee. Saw lots of people eating/hanging out/reading by themselves here. Definitely feels like a little oasis from the rest of the Mission.
author: Yin H.

description: Amazing space and awesome staff! We had our wedding at Stable this last weekend. It was more beautiful than we could have imagined. If you are considering it for yours, do it. The courtyard with its trees, succulents, and other greenery made for the perfect ceremony, cocktail, and dance space. We seated our guests in the back rooms for dinner. Which was equally beautiful with hanging plants, low lighting, and rustic decor. Their events coordinator, Minah, was incredibly helpful and responsive throughout the process and during the event. Finding Stable kicked-off our wedding planning, so it seemed fitting that it be our first review. Thank you Minah, thank you Stable. It wouldn't have been the same without you.
author: Jen H.

description: Wanted to love it; the bi-level space with mezzanine is cool and nicely set up! But bad coffee, wifi that doesn't work, and somehow they've managed to put like 15 things on their food menu but not a single vegan option. Will probably skip in the future.
author: Scott F.

description:
Came here on a rainy day and was cramped inside. Service wasn't the friendliest.

Came back in a sunny day and sat in the dreamy patio space and everyone was friendly and wonderful, but maybe my mood was just positive with the sun!

Would definitely come back here again on a sunny day :) free wifi, not sure about outlets.
author: Victoria C.

description:
My bf likes to show me all his new finds in the Mission and one Thursday morning before heading up to Yosemite to hike Half Dome that weekend, he took me to Stable Cafe.

Location: Definitely out of the way. There's basically nothing else around this area.

Food: The menu is small, but the choices are mouthwatering. For $7, I got the Pomba (toast, bacon, brie, and egg in the hole). The toast is Texas toast, lightly buttered and perfectly toasted. The bacon is nicely cooked with crisp edges, but still slightly chewy. The brie was laid over the hot toast and egg, making it melt and ooze into all the crevices. The egg was cooked to perfection and nicely scrambled in the hole. Two blackberries for garnish and this dish was just everything I could want in a sinfully delicious breakfast. So filling, it kept me going 'til we had an early dinner later that day!

Coffee: I got a latte with almond milk. Delicious. And cute coffee art on the top. Also bonus points for serving coffee in glass -- I'm a fan of this trend.

Service: You order at the counter and they bring the food to your number wherever you decide to sit. However, you need to grab your coffee yourself. I wanted a latte with 2% milk, but they only had whole milk and nonfat. The employee suggested a mixture of the two, but I said nonfat was fine. Then she suggested almond milk. It was like she read my mind! Always a fan of almond milk. Friendly service for sure :)

Ambiance: Cute place where you can have a leisurely breakfast, or grab something quick if you have 15 minutes to spare. They have a small seating area inside and a larger patio area outside adorned with a lot of cute drought-resistant plants. Apparently you can also rent out the back space which is good for small gatherings/parties.

Would I return? YES. Delicious food, great coffee, friendly service, and cute cafe.
author: Leana L.

description: I could spend literally hours here just sipping coffee or iced tea, trying just about anything from the menu, and soaking up the ambiance on Stable's patio--- the perfect place to do work from your laptop, share a meal, do some reading, catch up with friends, do some journaling... I went there the other afternoon to meet with some girlfriends and had the veggie sandwich-- so good!!! Can't wait to go back
author: Haley D.

description: One of my favorite neighborhood cafes! The staff is very friendly and they have great spice cookies and cold brew. There is a really nice back patio area with lots of seating (some in the sun and some in the shade). My only gripe is that they close early! Other than that, great place to catch up with a friend, get a little work done, or grab a quick bite to eat.
author: Dez T.

description: Delicious food and beautiful atmosphere. The staff is friendly, accommodating and a great place to chill, work, or grub.
author: Margot G.

description: This is one of my favorite neighborhood spots for a few reasons. 1) The staff is incredible - cool cats who are easy to get to know. 2) The spot was architected really well - open, gets a lot of light, and stays true to the stable theme. 3) The outdoor seating area / garden is perfect for hanging by yourself or catching up with a friend on a nice day. A couple negatives... Food could be better. Plants could be properly maintained. Also, note this is not a great cafe to work in. Spotty wifi and no outlets.
author: Reza B.

description: Great service- the coffee drink came out practically as I was done paying. The large side area is spacious with trees and other plants. Great place to hold a client meeting or coffee/lunch date.
author: Jeremy H.

description:
Loved the look and feel of this place. The outside patio felt like hanging out in a friend's well decorated backyard. Very comfortable and welcoming. The employees were friendly and upbeat. 

My only problem was that the avocado toast was not nearly enough food for a full breakfast and it wasn't as good as other places. 

Overall, I like this place and will be back because the patio is awesome.
author: Kelsey O.

description:
Everything on the "outside" gives a hip, welcoming feeling....that is until you receive service.

I'm a pleasant person, why do I always have to work at getting them to smile at me?

They never once said thank you, but I continue to smile and say thank you to them anyway.

Learned my lesson, I'm bringing my own beverage to my weekly appt.  hmmm I wonder why they have a help wanted sign at their entrance this time?
author: Cole R.

description: Definitely at the top of my breakfast places list. Great food and friendly staff. Id suggest trying their pomba
author: Rati M.

description:
Yummy place to have brunch! 

I'm a sucker for eggs.

I was initially going to get a plain old sandwich and add an egg but the Croque Madame was on display by the register and that beautiful sunny side up egg lured me into its grasp. 

My Croque Madame was yummy and very flavorful. The egg didn't disappoint however my only complaint is that it was a little too "oily" for my liking. By the end of my dish, I could see all the left over oil on my plate which kind of turned me off :/ Also the bottom layer of my bread was soaked and soggy by the end as well. Don't get me wrong, it was yummy but I just couldn't get myself to finish that soggy bottom bread :( 

Place has nice outdoor seating as well and perfect for a weekend brunch! The wait wasn't too long and service was pretty good.
author: June Y.

description:
Best coffee, food & staff! The outside space is a total gem in the city & the vibe is always relaxed & inviting. Dogs are allowed too!
Drip coffee is delicious & I've had multiple items off the breakfast menu & have never been disappointed. Come, relax & see for yourself.
author: Tasha M.

description: This is a review for their event rental services, AND for being our go-to neighborhood cafe. Both experiences have been exceptional. Mina was so helpful and calm throughout the process of touring, booking, planning, and the day of the event. It was important for us to have a wedding that felt cozy and friendly, and this experience extended to the great service we received. Stable was clear, flexible within their reasonable constraints, and helpful. Stable the cafe with it's incredible vibe, unusual and nourishing food, and friendly staff feels like our home away from home, and we feel so lucky that we were able to also get married there. Thank you!
author: Kathy J.

description: This cafe is absolutely adorable! The coffee was good and the staff is so friendly and welcoming. I had a chocolate chip cookie which would be on the same level as specialty's and an egg tart was was fantastic. I took off one star because the WiFi was not very good and i came to do some work in their beautiful garden.
author: Courtney H.

description:
I ordered a coffee - no special requests. Just a coffee.
The barista was rude 
Took 15 minutes to get my order 
But it was the wrong order. He gave me hot chocolate instead. 
Overcharged me by 2x
Cream for the coffee was expired
author: Vinayak R.

description: Great atmosphere and clean. You can sit outside in a succulent wonderland. I got the Piaf with avocado and toast, and drip coffee. So delicious. Everything was fresh and the people working were very friendly.
author: Amy G.

description: Love the out door patio went a few weeks ago for a private party and got to see the action of the out door oven impressive would of took pictures but I had forgot my phone in the car must go back soon
author: Angie L.

description: Trendy cafe with both indoor and outdoor seating. I had "the wrap" -- a bacon, egg, and cheese in a flour tortilla, which was pretty good -- and some great coffee. The barista was nice and the atmosphere was really warm and comfortable. On the expensive side of things, but not insane.
author: Spencer C.

description: Love the quaint atmosphere! I had the tostada salad and a latte and was very impressed, the food presentation was gorgeous and taste was amazing! I can't wait to go in the summer to sit in their out door patio
author: Roe A.

description:
This cafe was recommended to me and I'm so glad it was. The outdoor space is really unique and inviting; we could have sat there for hours. There are tons of succulents for purchase and a beautiful canope for shade.

I got the scrambled eggs with toast and jam. The jam was really pleasant and the eggs were cooked perfectly. I got a Mimosa or two, which is served in a regular drinking glass as opposed to a stemmed champagne glass. So you certainly feel like you're drinking more! I also ordered the fresh fruit, which was certainly fresh. The cafe is set up where you order food inside and are given a number. They then bring your food out, so I can't really comment on service. It seemed like all of the employees were friendly, though.
author: Mandy R.

description: right next to Watsi and amazing space, even a great venue for weddings.  food average.  mostly sandwiches, including panini pressed.  best for ambiance outside.
author: Rob C.

description: Great food, coffee and best of all a beautiful outdoor seating area. Excellent spot for a sunny day.
author: Carl S.

description:
A friend recommended I check out Stable, promising I would love it, so I had high hopes that were completely satisfied as soon as I stepped inside.  It's a small coffee shop, but very cute - A+ for atmosphere and cozy-ness (especially the upstairs seating).  I paid my first visit on a particularly cold day so I didn't get to enjoy the outside seating, but I will definitely be sure to come back on a warmer day since everyone raves about this.

Coffee was yummy as was my croissant.  The service is stellar here!  I also didn't get kicked off the wifi network once - woot! 

My only two complaints would be: 1) no outlets and 2) it closes at 4pm.  Someone PLEASE recommend a good coffee shop in the Mission that stays open late!!
author: Corrina S.

description: Loved the patio! It was really quiet. I ordered avocado toast and a side salad. Just finding parking was difficult.
author: Alina M.

description:
I ordered the avocado toast and asked to add a poached egg. They ran out of avocado and declared they don't poach eggs (only fry them) because they don't boil water to poach eggs. I ordered a tea (boiled water in a glass with a tea bag added) without issue.

I had the stable eggs instead which was fine. 

2 stars for the nonsense of being against poached eggs and running out of stuff during a Saturday morning brunch service.
author: Tom P.

description: A+ for ambiance! This spot is such a hidden gem with the most beautiful succulent garden in the back. Enjoyed the avocado toast and a vanilla latte, highly recommend the spicy and sweet combo. Definitely will be coming back!
author: Jenni M.

description: We were searching for a chill breakfast place in the mission after waiting in line for the Balmain x H&M for all of 10 minutes before deciding that we were very much over that shit and very hungry. We slid in right before breakfast was over and listen, amen for this sensible breakfast menu! I got something simple, eggs and toast with jam, while my friend got a breakfast wrap. The real winning apsect of this cafe is the large outdoor space, filled with succulents and wooden accents. It was a bit chilly but otherwise, we would've stayed longer. Would love to come back on a sunnier day!
author: Morgen B.

description: I wonder if they would notice if I moved in to their beautiful garden/patio and just...stayed? Stopped in here for Sunday breakfast/brunch and only had to wait a few minutes to order. By the time we had walked around outside admiring their gorgeous succulent plantings a table opened up and our food arrived - perfect timing! The De La Paz coffee is delicious with plenty of kick to get your morning jump started. I ordered the Pomba -- scrambled eggs dropped into a hole cut from unbelievable thick cut wheat bread, with strips of bacon and brie draped on top - and YES - it is as spectacular as it sounds. The husband had the Nono, an open-faced baguette sandwich with tomato, sunny side up eggs, and melted provolone. I would have tasted his, but before I could ask for a bite he had inhaled it. Parking not a real problem, at least on weekends - we found a spot directly across the street! We will definitely be back -- can't wait to try some of the other menu choices. Lovely place to spend a sunny...or foggy morning.
author: Lisa W.

description: Brought my niece and nephew & we loved it!! Options for everyone and an awesome atmosphere!
author: Thelma K.

description: You have to try the Mediterranean Wrap. So delicious! This is a great place to grab a quick bite to eat with seating both inside and outside
author: Debby G.

description: Dope spot. Love the outdoor breeze. The people that work here are awesome. Bring your smile and well wishes. A gem for the neighborhood.
author: Al B.

description:
It's one of those places. Have you been outside of your usual neighborhoods. You find a place to have coffee and fall in love with everything about the cafe... To the point you start to get excited every time you have an appointment in that part of town - so you can go back, try something new and love it all over again. This is that place. 
Come alone, come on business, come with friends or an afternoon date - just definitely try Stable. The food, drinks and coffee will never dissapoint. The staff is the friendliest and the space, indoors and out, is beautiful/comfortable/laid back perfection. 
And now it looks like they are adding night events. Wine and chocolate this Friday? I guess I'll have to start coming out to this part of town just to come here. I don't mind.
author: Kelly S.

description:
It's a sunny weekend in the Mission, everybody (hipsters!) and their mamas are out for brunch. You don't want to wait for a table. 

Where do you go?

Stable Cafe.

It seems like this is a secret spot of sorts since it's far out on Folsom st., but only a few blocks away from the craziness that is the area around Dolores Park. 

M. Davis designs did a swell job on converting this former police horse stable into a fully functional cafe without sacrificing the aesthetics: sliding glass barn door, terraniums, local art, loft style seating and lots of exposed beams. The sunlit filled space is super inviting, although I wish the seating was more comfortable. My tushie can't handle hard wood for more than 2 hours. Also,something a lot of coffee shops in SF don't have: a landscaped courtyard on the adjacent lot.

I love hanging out here whether I'm around the Mission or after attending dance class at ODC. Coffee beans are courtesy of Dela Paz. The cafe Americano is spot on, the watermelon agua fresca is thirst quenching and their brunch menu delivers: huevos rancheros (offered as a special on the weekends), Nona (egg in a hole with bacon and brie), bagels, etc.  The eggs are locally grown by the owner at his farm in Petaluma and you can't get any fresher than that! 

I've yet to try the pies from Three Babes Bakeshop, a pop-up on the weekends selling delicious pies for $5/slice. More reasons to come back! ;-)
author: Janice C.

description: Normally my reviews would cover a few food and at least one drink items. However today I came in to Stable Café after closing. We were diverted a few times on our drive from Tahoe so when the staff said "hey we can serve drinks for you and your son"  I was very thankful and it reminded me that I owe this place a solid review... Next time it will cover food... But this is one seriously tasty cucumber citrus Agua Fresca.
author: Alex J.

description: I'm not impatient however I've been waiting 55 minutes for a sandwich and half salad.  There are about 3 tables ahead of mine that have not received their food either and they were sitting down sipping their lattes for who knows how long.  Nice environment for coffee and a case good item.  Wait for made to order food is excruciating.
author: Bernard F.

description:
Stable Cafe is a good place for breakfast, brunch, and lunch. It's located near Folsom and 17th so a bit off the craziness on Mission. Maybe that explains why this place isn't too overly busy at times where you have to wait 30mins plus elsewhere to get a table.

The menu offers a variety of healthy breakfast choices - from yogurt, oatmeal, to bagels and sandwiches that are mostly combinations of either panini or dark bread with egg, and cheese/bacon/veggies on the side. I tried the Pomba (toast, bacon, brie, egg in the hole, $7) and Nono (eggs, tomato, cheese, toast, $7). Both was good but the portion size not too large. I was actually still hungry afterwards.

The coffee however was great - you can get French Press ($2.75) or regular coffee that was nicely bold and flavorful.

Apart from the food, nice job on the interior (fellow Yelper Janice C. mentioned it used to be a police horse stall before?) - Stable Cafe is not too big but they made the most of the rather small interior. 

I'll be back here when I'm in the area!
author: Sebastian F.

description:
This place serves what is easily the healthiest lunch in the Mission. Don't get me wrong, I love a carne asada burrito as much as the next guy, but when you need something a little lighter, you can't go wrong with an amazing Stable salad - maybe one with some avocado and chicken if you still need something hearty. 

If you do need an even heartier lunch, can I recommend their sandwiches? Stable has amazing bread, so all of their sandwiches taste just a little better. Also, Stephanie behind the counter is hilarious. Tell her I said 'hi.'
author: Dan S.

description:
Really awesome breakfast! I got the Nono, which is an open-faced sandwich with eggs, cheese and tomatoes. The eggs were cooked perfectly and the cheese was melted on the baguette. I enjoyed the coffee here at well- I got a black coffee and it was delicious. 

The back patio to Stable is shared with a succulent nursery, and there's plenty of space inside and out. Very good ambience and eclectic music.
author: Lauren G.

description: Gorgeous design, a lovely garden patio, food looks great, coffee is terrific and of course they use all the best milks & milk alternatives. Will definitely be back.
author: Be F.

description:
Decent. I've tried their pastries, salads and sandwiches-- all were average. Nothing was bad, but nothing stood out either. Service was also on the slower side.

I'm only giving 3 stars because the outdoor patio is sweet and simple when the weather's nice. But there are so many other options in the Mission...
author: Alyssa Y.

description:
At first you have this amazing hip space with one of the best courtyards I've seen in SF that doesn't require an entry fee. You also have a crowd that would otherwise illustrate the perfected mix of SF urbanite you read in those travel magazines.

However, the coffee plain sucks and the service isn't too off. Food is not bad, though highly overpriced. I recommend the Nana - toast with ham, eggs, and cheese. You can't go wrong with that.

I really wish they'd get the coffee right, but for now they are alright in my book... Since there's only so many places you can find such a serene outdoor area (that also doubles as a trendy succulent storefront).
author: Anthony N.

description:
Very cool cafe! I love love love the outdoor space. I came to study, but just ended up sitting and enjoying my coffee and surroundings. The more serious studiers may want to march upstairs to focus better.

I just wish this place stayed open later than 4pm.
author: Chris T.

description:
This is a fun little place that gets stars mainly for its amazing outdoor space. The indoor area is a little serving area with only a few seats on the lower level and a few additional ones upstairs. However, the outdoor area is amazing. There is a long courtyard lined with trees and a little succulent garden shop in the back. It's a great place to sit outside for a chat, to read, or to study. It's especially nice on those SF days when it's a little hotter in your apartment that you would like and need to get outside.

I've only had the coffees, of which the iced coffee and espresso drinks were both good. The food looks nice but I haven't had it.

The down side is that the internet is pretty unreliable, so be prepared to tether to your phone if you need internet.

All in all, one of the better outdoor spaces in the area.
author: Brent W.

description:
The pros: beautiful space, plenty of seating (both indoor and outdoor), allow dogs, good vegetarian options
The cons: SO expensive. They have increased their prices and their online menu (http://www.stablecafe.com/Assets/LUNCH-MENU.jpg) quotes their prices about $2-2.50 cheaper than what they charge in person

I've been here twice.

First time: hot chocolate and yogurt parfait. Hot chocolate looked beautiful but was TERRIBLE. Worst hot chocolate I've ever had. Super bitter, no chocolate taste to it at all (not even dark chocolate... it just tasted like bitter water). I threw it away after 2 sips. Parfait was decent, but the granola had a weird bitter taste to it, too.

Second time: Got the quinoa salad (good, but so not worth $11. The to-go version is tiny and way over-priced) and the croissant (good). Altogether, it was just shy of $15.

I WANTED to like this place. The space is beautiful. I could see myself taking a long lunch break in their beautiful outdoor space. But so far my experience has been subpar and expensive.
author: Marcella D.

description: Great food and people. I got a veggie sandwich with salad that so good. They also have a great coffee and bakery.
author: Rasit Y.

description: Coffee is good but four stars because of the outdoor seating area. Great patio with trees and plants and plenty of shade. When I was there a grill was going in the back and the wafting smell of hickory something really brought the whole ambiance together. I'll be adding this to my regular rotation.
author: Andrew S.

description:
WELCOME BACK! 

SO glad they are open again! PHEW!  I was worried that the best coffee space in the area was gone for good.   I now spend half my time in Vancouver BC and when I am there I miss this place something fierce--there is nothing like it up there. When I get back to SF it's my first stop right away. (I will take back what I said before about the slow coffee service. That has changed! ).
author: Uda W.

description: I found Stable Caffe randomly when I was in the area for a meeting and have been a few times now. The atmosphere is excellent. The service is s-l-o-w. There is one barista/server doing everything in the front. There may be a line 8 people deep and he is the only one to take orders, make lattes, run previously ordered food. As a result there is a significant amount of unnecessary waiting. If you aren't on a schedule, it's fine, but if you are hoping to go in and out in a couple of minutes to grab a cappuccino, you'll be late to wherever you are going.
author: Brie P.

description: This place is so gorgeous. I really wish the food were just a little better to match.  I got chilaquiles and couldn't eat it because it was ice cold when I got it. I'd much rather have my food come out before my friends' food than have it sit there getting cold. This place could be perfection so it's a bit disappointing that it's not...
author: claudia g.

description: They make their hot chocolate using their own chocolate! It was exactly what I look for in a hot cocoa. Nice atmosphere and outdoor patio on a fall day. The bread pudding was yummy too.
author: Ariel S.

description: I went here for a wedding reception this weekend. It was a great venue for such an event. I would recommend it to anyone.
author: Mister T.

description:
The outside area with all those plum trees make this a great place itself. Food could be better and my barista was not really the friendliest (maybe she was just having a bad day) so ending up with 4*.

Definitely come to sit outside, grab some fresh plums and chill. There are many better places for to-go food.
author: Gokhan T.

description: love this place in the summer, the garden gets full quickly but there's a quick turnover so it won't get long for you to find a spot. This place enjoys lots of sun and the menu is good. Not crazy yummy but enough to fill you. It is a bit expensive but I guess we pay for the location.
author: Nellie A.

description:
Stable Cafe has farm fresh eggs and nice looking pastries, a patio and upstairs seating too. service was relatively quick. got my joe and went.

pour: la paz coffee (l. 2.75)
-smooth, bold, and nonacidic.
3.5 stars

drips:
-while in line had to dodge U.B.O's (unifdentified breakfast objects) flying out of the kitchen to a table not too far away.
author: Victor G.

description:
I work near here and usually don't have a chance to leave the office to grab a bite.  That has all changed since finding this fabulous dining experience.  

My all time fav is the panini is the mozzarella pesto, tomato.  I have expanded to the daily specials which are pretty damn good.  

The staff is pretty upbeat and give good service.  


Finally-- I love the whimsical plants and planters... Yay I found some playful jelly fish type air ferns and sea urchin-- soon to christmas gifts!
author: Princess P.

description:
Perfect for a wedding in the city.

Last year my wife and I were planning our own wedding. It is a hard job and mostly because of all the decisions you have to make. There are lots of places who promise to save you from some of those decisions by providing a one stop shop for your wedding. You could be in a very nice venue having a very nice meal with your friends and family and be totally happy. We went to wine country and a few other destinations around the bay area and kept thinking we could do better everywhere we went. We just didn't want the same wedding, with the same white chairs, under the same trellis arch. 

We met in the city and decided to get married in the city. Minah and her team at Stable helped us arrange a perfect night in their beautiful space. They were incredibly accommodating to our needs and to our other vendors. Our coordinator told us one story about them needing to pull out a ladder and fix a tree branch which had fallen and just would not have looked right, just in time for our guests arrival. A lot of people will add stress to the days before your wedding, but not Stable Cafe. They are easy-going and extremely helpful.

One of the more important thing is that they are willing to work with any caterer and have an amazing kitchen. Trust me, this is a huge benefit. If you are having an event with around 85 people, this is a great space.
author: Eric G.

description:
(See pics) Review #1206. A great lunch spot with daily different special soup, sandwiches and panini sandwiches. The special usually is pretty creative too.

Love the rustic wooden feel of the place, laid back to grab a good cup of De La Paz while you enjoy the sun either inside the cafe, or outside in the patio.

The upstairs seating is a bit odd as patrons facing the door on a level where there is no front cover. So don't wear any shorts or skirts if you decide to sit on that side.
author: T L.

description:
Came here to kill some time before an appointment.

It's incredibly "San Francisco" but without being obnoxiously so... namely, there are succulents planted everywhere and the interior design looks like it was directly inspired right off some image on Pinterest. Employees were incredibly friendly, if not a little understaffed, but that's no fault of theirs of course. I had a simple salad plus a beer, because that's how I roll, and I was delighted that they didn't skimp on the olives. No bland, flavorless tomato slices to be found either, as is my common complaint with the standard house salads found in other cafes and restaurants.

Not sure if I'll end up back here, given how often I'm in S.F. (let alone the Mission) anyway, but I'd happily recommend this place to a friend!
author: Courtney S.

description: Enjoyed my time at the Stable Cafe this morning. The woman at the counter was helpful and knowledgeable about gluten free options. I ordered the Piaf and a cup of coffee. Both were excellent! Loved the atmosphere. We sat upstairs which was pleasantly warm on this chilly San Francisco morning. I can't wait to return!
author: Stacey A.

description:
Went in to grab a coffee and some lunch, encountered a coffee barista thats worse than a methhead having a bad day. While waiting in line to place an order, the employee became frustrated and started shouting that his previous customer hadn't picked up his coffee. He complained it was getting cold. 

Unfortunately, I was in the wrong place at the wrong time as he thought it was mine, though I hadn't placed my order. I motioned to him that it wasn't mine and I explained I hadn't placed an order yet.

While talking with the polite cashier, He hovered inches from my face listening to the order. I ordered a cappuccino, and he slammed to cold latte in-front of me and said "THERE YOU GO!!". I casually told the cashier I was looking for a cappuccino and a sandwich to go, and he dumped it out.

In his frustration he made a cappuccino in a regular cup "not to go". I asked him for it "to go". He told me I could drink my coffee and when I wanted it "to go", I could come back, get in line, wait, and get the remainder poured into a to-go cup. I explained that wasn't what I'd like to do, I'd really just like my correct order "to-go".  He made faces at me, and I asked for his manager. 

He refused to get his manager.

Upon leaving I asked again with a different employee for the manager, as I left he was shouting across the restaurant "WHAT YOU WONT EVEN TALK TO ME!?!?!?" and followed me down the street to complain at me.

This guy was on some serious drugs, the manage (Francisco) offered me a free lunch on him for the trouble.

I don't recommend going here if you're looking for a chill atmosphere, this barista was hostile.
author: Ross C.

description: Very cute. Love the outdoor space. Great spot to bring your lap top for work or to just relax and eat.
author: Jessica K.

description:
A cute, cozy spot in the Mission to grab a cup of good coffee and a pastry.

The outdoor garden patio is a place where you can easily spend an entire afternoon and not know where the time went...they have a cute succulent garden stand that is open during cafe hours as well.

Latte was tasty. They have almond milk (!!!) and soy for those of us who are off the dairy train. The incredibly sweet and funny barista took note that it was my boyfriend's birthday and insisted on giving "the birthday booooyyyy" a cookie on the house. It was the best peanut butter cookie ever! The rest of the pastries and food items looked good as well.
author: Liz G.

description:
I love the fact they have a patio and an upstairs area. Every time I've been here it has been empty and I always find room to sit. Upstairs can be stuffy, but overall love it

Food is also amazing

They unfortunately don't have outlets which is a total buzz kill
author: Dorris W.

description:
I stop by every morning on my way to the office. Great coffee, great b.fast. 

The baristas are v. friendly -- they know my name and my order. I tip well, they treat me well. That's how it is. 

My only caveat is that the wait time is a bit long for food and sometimes drinks. 

Also, they close at 4pm.
author: Andy K.

description:
I loved everything about that place. The employees were super friendly and nice, food was even better and the sitting area in the back was the only way to enjoy a decent meal.

I had a breakfast almost every day during my stay in SF and every day there was something else to try.

Next time, this will be my first visit...
author: Erc V.

description:
Quite good coffee on the expensive side, stepped in on a cold day for a coffee & I liked the hard wood-pub feel atmosphere. The food is quite expensive & if your in the neighbourhood and have some money to dish out then this is a fast style interesting place. I think there is free wifi. The upstairs is quite nice.

But this is by no means a place for a lengthy Lunch/Afternoon Tea and the Service is Terribly Casual.
author: Julian I.

description:
I went to Stable Cafe for brunch - it had been on my to-try list for a while. You order at the counter. The menus are not in one consolidated space. The breakfast and panini menu are off to your right, the lunch menu is to your left semi-hidden by the flight of stairs, and there are additional options written on the glass with a display of the food.

I had the Mate Latte (I admit I ordered this partly because it's fun to say, but also because I am a fan of Yerba Mate). Intriguing - you can definitely taste the Yerba Mate and the drink is a comforting, pastel-green color. Overall it was pretty mild.
I had the chicken sandwich, which was ok. The patty was a bit overcooked and big, but I enjoyed the roasted peppers and provolone. I also had my sister's chicken panini. I'm always a fan of panini because of the way the cheese melts and melds with the bread. In this case the chicken was cut too thickly and the cheese took a backseat.

I also know Stable Cafe has their Winter Warmer Wednesdays, collaborating with the Cheese School for happy hours (cheese galore for $15) so that might be worth checking out. I haven't been to it myself so can't vouch for it. Also it's supposed to run until the end of January so I'm not sure if it will be around much longer. 

Overall, would I come back? It's a cute cafe. It shares a space with a succulents nursery and the SF Cheese School, so on nice days take your food out to the courtyard and enjoy the sunshine. But I ate there once, and now I'm over it, can remove my bookmark and move onto the next great brunch place in San Francisco.
author: Brandy A.

description:
Laptop camper here. The former stable for police horses turned into a coffeehouse features 2 floors, an industrial vibe, and wood everywhere including the exposed building beams. Small tables and outdoor seating are inviting and the wi-fi is free, but there isn't a power outlet to be found in the seating areas.

The pastries look better than average and the eggs are "farm fresh" courtesy of a farm in Petaluma. The menu includes frittatas, granola, oatmeal, sandwiches, salads, etc. The menu is seasonal.

* Breakfast sandwich $5 - eggs weren't nuked but cooked nicely with gooey cheese, folded over, with scallions, served on thin wheat toast with seeds and nuts and stuff. The bread tasted really healthy and dry. 
* Latte $3: one size, not bad but bitter on bottom, organic beans from De la Paz

The café clearly doesn't encourage lingering. Even the chairs are uncomfortable.

You know you love me. X0 X0, laptop camper.
author: Lolia S.

description:
The long (not Fabio long, more like middle-aged woman long), curly/wavy-haired guy who works at the register is nauseatingly unpleasant. Sorry, but I don't remember ordering a side of contempt with my Luna sandwich. 

The one star is for that one guy only, and it's because of him that I will not be returning. The food was decent, though ~ 3.5 stars. And the guy who actually brought us the food (possibly the manager) was nice.
author: Eugene M.

description:
Date & Time:  Friday September 11, 2009 @ Noon
Stars:  3.5
Company:  Michael & Jack
Crowd:  Cool Mix of 20-Something Hipsters & 40-Something Business Crowd
Vibe:  Quaint
Decor:  Paradox of Charming & Rustic in a Loft Space.     
Service: Cute Efficient Male Hipster
Imbibe:  French-Press & Latte.  Lemon Agua Fresca
Devour:  Ham & Cheese Panini
Skip:  Roast Beef Sandwich
Total:  $22.17
author: Genevieve Y.

description: The waitress with the tatoo down her neck was incredibly rude, ignoring me at first and acting befuddled when i asked her if i could order, as if offended by my audacity. How dare i! Then she called on the next person even before i started to sign the receipt. No thank yous given. Was it my uniform? Did i not look hipster enough? Should've hit Starbucks. And their coffee tastes like metal.
author: Pedro G.

description:
If coffee cafes were bars, Stable's analogous alcoholic avatar would be a sexy, chandeliered cocktail lounge, where style dwarfs admittedly substantive substance. 

Pretension comes part and parcel: the baristas tend to be aloof; the bulk of the seating exists in a large, outdoors courtyard that doubles as a high-end succulent nursery (that's right - dedicated to the populace that shops for $70 terrariums while sipping on espresso); and the Mission District in-crowd, wielding their (our) new tech and old bikes, is the primary patron.  

Nonetheless, it would be a challenge for even the most corporate cog to sit at Stable Cafe and experience any significant degree of displeasure. It's spacious and beautiful outside. The dainty interior is decked with big windows and wrought of warm wood; the food ($5-$12) is unobjectionably basic and inexpensive fare. 

Highly recommended, if for nothing beyond a good sit.
author: Liz C.

description: Really cool spot! Lots of outdoor space and the staff is super friendly. I'll be there pretty often!
author: David L.

description:
Homey feel, yummy food, and great place to getaway. 

For some reason every time I come to this place I can't help but feel at home. I love how small it is and I love the fact that its in such a residential area. Sometimes when I want to getaway for a bit and just spend some good ol' alone time this is the place I like to go. The food is nice and healthy and the portions are just right. Everything is quite simple. The atmosphere, the food, the seating all work with one another to create this little cafe like coffee shop. This review is an overall review for the place and it's my own personal experience of all the times I have spent at Stable Cafe. Hopefully when you decide to try this place you will have the same experience I have every time I go here.
author: Jacqueline C.

description:
Good food and super cute outdoor garden space spoiled by rude service from two of the three staff members there today. Not cool. 

Also, I attempted to order a salad off the regular menu at 1:30pm only to be told they weren't serving it until 2:00pm. Huh?

It's a shame about the two obnoxious servers (who, incidentally, were rude to multiple members of our large group). My advice to management: Hire nicer people. Otherwise, this place would be a great spot.
author: Kerri W.

description:
What's going on with the 3.5 stars?? I'm totally shocked. My first experience at stable was awesome, just the perfect place to enjoy a perfect SF summer day. 

I had SUCH a different experience with the service! Our service was spot on. The servers were energetic and friendly, made my hibiscus mimosa the second I ordered it, and with a smile. They brought our food out promptly, again with smiles and jokes.
