Lets talk about the most delightful thing about stable...the SPACE. It is just so beautiful. It caught my eye while I was driving by, and I knew we had to check it out ASAP. Turns out that SF gave us a gorgeous week, and stable was the perfect place to enjoy the weather. The modern rustic vibe, the gorgeous garden with succulents adorning the walls, the garden in the back, the open spacious interior...we sat there for hours, re-ordering plate after plate because we just wanted a reason to stay longer. 

Sure, the food isn't michelin rated, but it's a cafe, relax! We had a pear/brie panini, and a fig/goat panini. I wasn't into the fig nor did I like the choice of bread, but did enjoy the pear/brie. The quinoa salad was excellent though, refreshing and great for a warm day. 

Please go enjoy the space. You owe it to yourself.
author: Sylvie C.

description:
BEST PANINI'S I HAVE HAD BY FAR!!

I've been here several times and just love their tomato, mozzarella, and pesto panini. I have sampled other panini's from friends, which are still pretty good but I always stick with my tomato, mozzarella, and pesto. Their ingredients are so fresh yet so simple. I have even ordered this same panini combo at several other places, but theirs taste like sh*t compared to Stable's. Seriously, you will be amazed how much simple quality ingredients make a big difference.

They have a large outdoor seating area which I really enjoy and Stable is located in a great area of SF that is usually sunny. It's a great spot to have lunch with friends and enjoy just the comforting ambiance that Stable brings.
author: Liana D.

description: This place place is "cool".  Really tasteful decor, modern rustic interior, and an awesome loft area upstairs.  Reasonable prices and the typical SF, hipster urbanite clientele but never super-packed.  I've had the mate latte (good) and some breakfast items (good) and have always been pretty pleased.  The only thing that really deducts stars for me is that the baristas have come off as slightly disgruntled/annoyed with each other and customers.
author: Trish P.

description:
This was a real catastrophe of poor service.

I came here with a friend for brunch today before heading over to our office nearby. It was pretty evident from the first interaction with the staff that at least one staff member was drunk or high. But hey, as long as they do their jobs, who cares?

We both separately ordered a Luna; I also got a cup of coffee and he an Americano. For some reason, I was given a table number placard and he was not. I assumed that would be because they would deliver both our meals to the same table--that turned out not to be the case.

I ordered first, but he got his coffee first. After about 5 minutes of waiting for my coffee, I asked about it, and was bafflingly told, "We drank it." Okay? I asked for a new one, and they made it for me.

Upstairs at our table, I got my food about ten minutes later. They took the table number away, leaving us to wonder how they would know where to bring my friend's food. I ended up finishing my meal before my friend got his--and we ordered the same thing within a minute of each other. He went down to ask about it. 

Meanwhile, the couple next to us had the complete wrong order brought to one of them, and the one whose food did not arrive also went downstairs to complain.

(Edit: My friend finally got his food and filled me in on his trip downstairs. Apparently, he dealt with a second waitress who was also obviously in an altered state, who was eating and drinking while he was trying to converse with her, and she didn't seem to care much about the situation.)

My friend came back upstairs and a few minutes later, the obviously-impaired server followed. Clearly having a trouble time forming a coherent sentence, and giggling the whole time, she told him, "We're going to take a little longer making your Luna, okay?" Not caring to make a fuss, my friend said that was fine.

By this point the guy at the table next to us who got the right order had finished his, and his partner was still downstairs trying to figure out where hers was. They received a complimentary cookie as an apology (they said it tasted disgusting).

About 20 minutes later, my friend got fed up with waiting and went downstairs to check again. He was told, completely inexplicably, that they simply weren't making his order and had forgotten about it. They said they would start again.

Eventually, the table next to us got their correct order, preposterously late. At this point we had been there close to an hour in total. My friend suggested I just head over to the office without him, since who knows when this debacle would finally resolve itself? So I did that, and then I started writing this review. He still doesn't have his food.

Nice one, Stable. Bang-up job. You've inspired the second Yelp review I've ever written in my life.
author: Chris R.

description:
How is this place not a 5-star for everyone?  

What an incredible place -- definitely the best way to start the morning.  Great coffee, incredible patio, beautiful setting... love Stable.

The Quinoa for lunch is incredible, and the breakfasts can't be beat!
author: Andrew K.

description:
A solid cafe, no other way to say it. Good coffee, great pastries and food (that I've had). 

The other thought that comes to mind every time I'm here is that the food service is too damn slow. It's worth the wait, but still, it's too long a wait.
author: Ian M.

description:
What a gem.  I found Stable Cafe by chance - just driving by.  It has an awesome patio - super large with a mix of 'shade' and 'sun' seating.  Inside the cafe is equally as cool, with a loft-style hipster vibe.  I liked it. 

The food was great - super awesome salad - very large, enough for two to split (if you're having something else).  I enjoyed the frittata (could have been spiced-up a bit more, but still great).  My friend had the chicken provolone panini - delish.   

It's a great place to go for sunday brunch when you want something simple, to be outside, and not have crazy lines/waits.
author: Jim D.

description: I loved the outdoor patio - such a nice atmosphere to sit and work or socialize. I haven't eaten here so can't comment on the food, but The coffee is good!
author: Maggie T.

description:
Nice place to work on your computer or just chill and listen good music. Nice backyard to enjoy the sun. 

Good vegetarian foods : Veggie Sandwich and pesto-tomato-mozza panini. The Chai soy latte is also sweet and spicy.

Nice service, the waiters are super sweet.  

The only problems are : Close too early 4.30-5pm,  no plugs to charge your computer and no vegan options.
author: Dassine B.

description:
THE MISTERY OF THE BLACK BUILDING
(3.8 stars)

The day i went they had some great music playing. Not sure what genre it was but it was better then all other cafe music i've heard. Great face, away from busy but close to busy. Parking was cake. The place is not in a busy area but of walking distance to busy-ness. No line and plenty of seating. Three Babes Bakeshop and Stable Cafe share the outdoor seating area. I'm such an idiot for ordering at Stable Cafe and not ordering anything from Three Bades Bakeshop (they server mini pies). 

- Food, good (fresh and organic)
- Price, decent
- Service, good
- Ambiance, cute cozy cafe

Passed this place everytime I do my grocery shopping at Rainbow Groceries. It was definately one of those Sundays where "it's too damn nice to be inside doing nothing". I've dedicated Sundays as cafe days when I have no plans and nowhere to be; hiding from the world "LEAVE ME ALONE" kind of mood because I need to catch up on a book.

HEFFER-STYLE STATUS.

**See picture**

POMBA ($6.50) - the menu online is false, i was charged $6.50. It was toast, bacon (cant eat meat at this time), gouda, and a whole egg. Presentation of the place was clean; didnt understand why the bacon and the slice of gouda made an "X" over my toast. When they say "A WHOLE EGG" they literally cut a perfect circle in my thick slice of toast and put the egg inside (pretty cool!). It was a simple breakfast, nothing filling. I did not feel heavy after eating. 

HOT COCOA (~$2+) - off the caffine and had to go with a different hot beverage. cocoa was creamy and smooth. they did not and nor did i, add any sugar. servered in a glass cup with a cool crooked spoon.

PELLIGRINO (~$2) - ordered me some snotty water to quench my thirst.

It was lunchtime and other people around me have ordered lunch items. I am a fool, i totally should have ordered a lunch item. They looked healthy and filling and the sandwiches look great. I suggest coming here to get lunch over breakfast.

Will I be back? Yes (for lunch). Its not like all those other cafe's in the city where it's overly packed. I can enjoy a cafe environment on my laptop, with my book, or with my journal.

Until the next review..
author: Jane A.

description: My husband and I got married at the Stable Cafe and we couldn't have been happier with Minah and her team. The venue is so intimate and special and Minah made it very easy to plan our wedding there. She quickly responded to all of my questions, addressed any concerns I had, and accommodated the requests I made in the months leading up to the event. On the day of the wedding she and her team had everything set up well ahead of schedule and exactly as I had envisioned it. The event went off without a hitch! Thanks so much to Minah and the Stable Cafe!
author: Chloe E.

description: Hip, good coffee, decently priced food for a hipster cafe. Great outdoor seating area.
author: Matt B.

description:
Stable cafe is one of my new favorite places to have brunch on a sunny morning. I especially love the outdoor seating in the garden area with all the succulents and the modern rustic interior design is dreamy. I always get the "luna" if its on the menu because it is TO DIE FOR! Egg, ham, cream cheese and mozz on a toasted bagel. 

If you get a chance to take a peek at the back room at the end of the garden its amazing! I'm not sure if its a shop or private dining or for catering events, but its got a giant brick oven and a tree and succulents galore!
author: Erin R.

description:
140711.       1st of many
                     Best looking outside dining for a cafe
                           Plus ... using drought tolerant plants as decor
                     Above average lasagna ... in-house made food (assumed)
                     Have huge kitchen at the rear of the house
                     Eat and Run review      

Coffee ------------------- 4
Food --------------------  4
Atmosphere ----------- 4 1/2   Best looking patio for the price range
                                               One of my favorite outdoor dining place!

Coffee:
      La Paz
      Cappuccino
      

Pro
Lasagna
      Vegetarian
      Nice and thick robust sauce

One of best place to chill out. Making u wish your house backyard looks like that.
author: S.K. Y.

description:
I so wanted to love this place.  The owners are great.  The concept is great.  The design is great.

The service is awful.

You can be the only person there and it still takes 20 minutes to get a bagel.  I'm so sorry, but I just don't have the patience to go there anymore, when other places hire people who actually move you through the experience so that the person behind you also has a shot at getting something.
author: Doug J.

description:
The location is right near work, the paninis and salads are good and the side yard next to Stable is beautiful.  

My one criticism is that the service is so slow! It always takes forever to get food to-go and the last time I was in, it seriously took 15 minutes to get a quinoa salad. If you're going to charge $9 for a salad and $10 for a sandwich, I think it's fair to get stuff out of the kitchen at a reasonable pace. I'm not sure if it's the systems they have in place or the fact that they don't have a POS system but it's painful to watch. Let's pick it up folks!
author: Jenn W.

description:
This place is hipster heaven! The staff are really friendly and energetic, the food selection is great, but the ambiance is what really makes it.

They have a cute little upstairs, and an incredible patio. When the weather is good there is no better place to be. Comfortable seating and good food, also plenty of filtered water too! They have a self-serve jug which I really like. 

For food I had the tortilla soup and the quiche. The soup was nicely seasoned with just a bit of kick to it, but the quiche was worth writing home about! I have had a lot of quiche but not one this good for a long time. It had the right balance of cheese, egg, ham, tomato, and crust. It was flavorful and fresh; not too much egg taste. 

Now I didn't try the coffee - trying to limit my coffee to once a day. However I will be back for coffee and update my review.
author: Chris S.

description:
5 stars for atmosphere. One of the coolest spots in the city for sure.

 If only the food were as good.  Not bad at all. Just not in the same league as some of the city's best, and doesn't measure up to the killer atmosphere. And for me it's all about the food. Why can't we have both?

There are a few jems. Asparagus and eggs. Savory scone.

Staff is great. Friendly. Interesting. :) It can take a while to get your food. I'm guessing the kitchen is smaller than the staff would like. Hats off to them for doing what they can. Owners, are you listening?
author: Bib G.

description:
Great music. Aesthetics. Friendly environment. Good Coffee.

The aesthetics of this place are absolutely wonderful. Indoor and outdoor garden seating are both, just, lovely! 

The staff was quite friendly and also, understanding- I know this place has a reputation of being inconsistent, but I have had good experiences so far. 

This is the type of place you go to and sit for an hour or two to just relax and work. This is not your usual in and out cafe. It can be very slow, but I like that- it helps me wind down from all the city hustle and bustle.
author: Stephie M.

description:
Bingo! Hunger for lunch and a good vibe led us to The Stable Cafe. 
The charming Spaniard who took our order at the counter, greeted us like long lost compadres. Menu is simple, inexpensive,  and fresh, and delivered to your table (lots of outdoor seating at picnic tables, in the lovely urban garden patio). We ordered 2 sandwiches, and they delivered one (!) but were quick to remedy the situation.
author: Bonnie B.

description: If your coming for the interior, this place ranks 5 stars! but if your coming here for the coffee and service its a hit or miss. Ive been going to this coffee shop for about a month now, the staff here act very inappropriate. I have only been treated kindly a few times out of being here for an entire month. There happens to be no outlets, which is a buzz kill. The wifi is slow, and doesn't work half the time, if you ask the staff to fix it they will tell you its because too many people are on it. I go to a college campus that has one wifi network for thousands of students, and they can't even manage to fix the one they have now. Its a bummer because the way this place was designed is magnificent, the outside seating is so nice on a hot sunny day. I wish the staff would smile and be a little more friendly, I felt the vibe instantly of judgment when I walked up to the cashier. See for yourself, this review has been based of my experience, I hope anyone new that comes here has a better experience than me.
author: Glasha S.

description:
All I wanted last Sunday was a great cup of coffee and some yummy pastries.  One of my friends suggested we all meet at Stable.  I left Stable still pining for a great cup of coffee and some yummy pastries.

Food = 1.5:  My press coffee tasted like instant and didn't come in a french press. It came in a small glass cup.  It was also grossly lukewarm.  One star up for having soy milk available as one of the creamers.  I ordered a cheese scone and a bagel with PB&J.  The scone was pretty good but the bagel was a complete and utter bust.  Stale and, while it came with peanut butter, it also came with orange marmalade.  They should be a little more specific and let customers know that the "jam" in the PB&J is actually orange marmalade, especially for those of us who dislike orange marmalade.  Hmm, how about they label it Bagel with PB&M???

Service = 2.0:  The service was okay but then again, I ordered coffee and pastries and no hot food.  I didn't encounter any dirty hipster attitude from the servers last Sunday.  Whew!  Other Yelpers were not so lucky.

Atmosphere = 1.0:  The indoor area is limited but looks like it would be nice to spend time in there.  That explains why we didn't get a table inside (i.e. coffeehouse squatters with laptops and extension cords). There is a large outdoor area with a large pool of muddy water in the middle.  Yuck.
author: Eddie L.

description:
I love Stable. Great coffee, and reasonably priced food. The outdoor seating in the succulent garden is awesome and every time I go there are tables available. The Nono is a great simple breakfast, and I've yet to get my eggs anything but perfectly cooked. 

My one and only hope is that they someday replace their silverware. The Nono is pretty simple, provolone on an egg, on a slice of tomato, on toast...but the inadequate silverware makes even that a bit of a challenge to cut through without grinding into the flatware.
author: Colin M.

description: Came looking for a coffee shop to have coffee and a bite as well as work on the computer. I got a nice vegetarian frittata and an iced mocha. The place is overpriced and their drinks are extremely small. When I went upstairs to eat and work on the computer I found there is zero outlets in the place. The people are kind and atmosphere is welcoming however.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Beautiful space, horrible service. Came here for the first time the other day and had a pretty similar experience to the rest of the reviewers. 
The coffee was decent, the space is really nicely done, particularly the outdoor patio. The service on the other hand was pretty unpleasant. Staff were curt and disinterested. They were blabbing really loudly amongst themselves and saying all sorts of stupid sh*t. Eventually it was too much of an annoying distraction and we left. Probably won't be back. 

Stable, you have so much potential! Get your act together...
author: Super C.

description:
This place is really amazing in some ways and just blows in other, specifically price & service, but it is so cute I really don't want to go lower than 3 stars.

Atmosphere -  5 stars: I've never been to a cooler looking coffee shop. They have great art on the walls and an amazing patio full of plants. 

Coffee & Food - 2 stars: I got an iced americano tasted OK, but they seriously gave me about 6oz of coffee for $3. I also got a plain bagel, again tasted OK, but it seemed like one of those bagels that's actually just a piece of bread shaped like a bagel. 

Price - 1 star: Really not satisfied with how much I paid for what I got. I have no problem blowing money on coffee as long as it's worth it. They were charging $5.50 for PB&J toast ... 

Service - 1 star: I went in and there was only one other person in there. I still waited 20 minutes for coffee and a bagel. Get your act together.
author: Raquel L.

description: Amazing place!!! Amazing food, coffee and beautiful back yard to sit ! I think this may be my new favorite place.
author: Sheena C.

description:
Well the space is beautiful... Food was really bland, boring menu, tired options! 

Service was very rude (no smile, not helpful, curt and a bad attitude about everything) and then the wrong item was brought out. I almost didn't want to bring the food back for fear I would be scolded! When I took it back the woman at the counter approached the chef, they argued playfully, then she made the universal "she's crazy!" symbol while sort of trying to duck out of my view... Sigh. I'm crazy because I expect my overpriced panini to be a panini and not some weird mushroom grilled cheese? Well the correct sandwich was not great anyway, boring chicken and cheese on a baguette. Later I realized I had been charged too much as well. Just, ALL BAD! 

Don't go here! But if you must, I hope you don't get the short haired girl with a French accent. I see other yelpers had similar experience with the same girl, is she a close friend of the owner or something?! Shame because I really wanted this place to be great since the setting is gorgeous! Maybe they will rethink the employees and menu so this place can shine!

Yikes! Won't be going back!
author: Sierra M.

description:
This place is good and has an awesome outdoor patio, but good lord what is with the attitude from employees? 

Came here early this afternoon and was waiting for a friend, so I decided to go ahead and place an order. I was going to get some yogurt when i was rudely reminded "actually I can't do that for you. We actually stop serving breakfast at 11" *smirk*. Ordered some coffee and literally 3 people had to help with the transaction and at one point the same employee tried to hand me back my money when someone else finally took over and gave me my change. 

The customer ahead of me had her latte made right away and here is where I guess someone decided to go on break and no one was making anymore coffee. I waited a few minutes and my friend arrived, we greeted each other and she waited in line to place her order. She asked me what I wanted and I told her I already ordered and was still waiting for my latte.

After 10 minutes all it took was the woman with long braided hair overhearing my conversation about waiting for coffee that she decides to finally make it. But not without talking about me to her coworker while I was just 2 feet away "yeah the one with the lips" (I was wearing dark lipstick) "she couldn't wait for her coffee". 

I've heard this place has an attitude problem from so many people and now that I've finally been here I can see what they mean. I only wish I could have taken back my tip from such rude service.
author: Eilene G.

description:
I actually really liked this place since they have a really nice open space patio, but now DISLIKE it after receiving RUDE CUSTOMER SERVICE by a girl-worker with a short weird bangs w an accent.  

Food is alright - so now the only good thing left here is the atmosphere.
author: Shine W.

description: Good food and great atmosphere, BUT terrible wi-fi (I had to use the wi-fi on my phone the whole time I was there), and the african american lady at the front taking orders had a terrible attitude. I also found hair in my food. Definitely won't be returning.
author: Vanessa Y.

description:
Stable Cafe is my favorite plan for bunch. 

Why only 3 stars? It's horribly inconsistent.  I'm a regular (I go to Stable about every other week, and have been doing so for the past year or so), and am always surprised at my final bill, the size of my food/drinks, and how quickly (or not) my food arrives.  I don't get the sense that new employees are trained very thoroughly.  One example of this: the Mate Latte.  Usually it comes in a large cup, and is perfect - just sweet enough, the mate is perfectly steeped, etc. Sometimes though, it's in a small cup (for the same price!), no honey, and too bitter to drink.  The only pattern seems to be that new employees in particular really struggle with making the drink, which makes me think that more training before they get behind the counter would be helpful. 

Or the french press coffee. There are two prices: $2 for a small, and $2.75 for a large.  However, there was a period of time when suddenly all "for here" prices for coffee changed to $2.75 for a small coffee, no refills. I asked why, and was told by a new employee, "It's just how we do it here."   So now I just order my coffee in a to-go cup to avoid the confusion, even if I plan to drink it at Stable (saves me .$75 too, if I order a small). 

I've also gotten basic sandwiches that should come with ham, without any ham (and lots of eye-rolling if asked for a side of ham to add to the sandwich).  Or  wraps that are missing bacon. Or sandwiches on a bagel that should be on a croissant.

Sometimes I'm overcharged, sometimes undercharged. I'll point this out if I notice while I'm there, but, with a menu that's relatively straightforward (at least for brunch), I'm not sure why there's so much variance in the bill.  

The people behind the counter can be friendly and nice, or completely rude. 

I keep coming to Stable though because the food is just SO GOOD. Best eggs in the city. As long as you're prepared to deal with inconsistency (I try to think of it as an adventure!), you'll enjoy your meal here.
author: Anne D.

description: Just based on the look and feel of this place I wanted to give it more stars but  the food while it looked amazing lacked a bit of the flavor I was hoping for.  I got the Stable Eggs and it was all really good and I devoured it but it was missing something to it.  My wife had the Nona and that was good.  We weren't too full after we left which can be a good or bad thing.  Awesome spot to get some work done and grab a bit to eat though.
author: Blake B.

description:
So many places in San Francisco do what this barn, I mean, "Stable" does: pretend to be authentic  European (Spanish, in this case) and pretend to cater to the, uhum, healthy-eating wanna-be-vegetarian anti-traditional hipsters...Give me a break for once, bum city! This place gave me a diarrhea with their mushroom brie sandwich!!!! Yes, I did notify the manager. Their French onion soup is bland and has the wrong consistency, just like most of their dishes! Their dishes are not fresh and they are precooked and microwave heated! Their kitchen is dirty!! Their service is inattentive or overly casual (distracted order takers who'd rather focus on chitchatting amongst themselves!) They close too early!!!!! But, of course, if you're a local, you won't discern what I mean.

The only good things: 1) their coffee is excellent; 2) their bathroom is pleasant and clean; and 3) they're practically the only cafe in the area, a very much needed cafe!!! 

I'm so disappointed!
author: Raymond F.

description:
As beautiful as Stable Cafe was, the horrible service inspired me to write my first yelp review. I went to Stable Cafe on a Saturday around noon. It had a steady flow of people, but not very busy. What first threw me off was the nasty look I got from the girl at the register. I still can't figure out a reasoning for. My friend and I then waited quite a bit of time for our food, which later didn't make too much sense because the portions were so small. So my brother, who was also wondering where his latte was after 15 minutes, and I decided to go inside and see what was taking so long. The two waitresses we're hanging out behind the counter having a conversation, while five plates were sitting next to them getting cold. They then brought out our food, but the waited another 5-10 minutes for my friend to get her food and my brothers latte. 

The food was good and the outdoor space was beautiful, but based on the poor service I received I will never go back. I would much rather have anyone give me great friendly service, than a Urban Outfitter Model with no work ethic.
author: Valentina E.

description:
This place is really cute, I liked the look and feel of the place as well. My expectations were set a little low HAHHAHA because apparently  the staff had been unfriendly and the service was not prompt in the past. However for the Sunday morning that I was there, the staff was friendly and service was decent. Seems like they fixed the kinks. 

I had the Stable eggs and we shared a scone and a croissant.  Shared you say? You never share! (OCD). I can't say it's the best food ever, but it was decent and filling. I ate all my food so I'd have to say it was a good overall. They have a cute outdoor area and while it was a little chilly I enjoyed the coffee and my company quite a bit. =)
author: K T.

description: This place is beautiful, the food is great, and the prices are very reasonable. The staff is a delight, including Stephanie, who made a point of mentioning that she remembered me from years ago from another restaurant, and welcomed me to Stable Cafe.  (And for the ladies; yes, clean bathrooms.)
author: Chuck Y.

description:
Let me first say--- the only reason why I am not giving 5 stars is due to the odd rules placed upon orders... if you get a Panini or sandwich to go, you don't get a side salad.. but if you eat it "for here", you do... hmm.

Besides that, I have had great experiences at Stable.. The outdoor area is faaaantastic! Perfect set up and gorgeous!  Outside brunch is always nice-- especially because it's hard to find a lot of out door seating in this city! 

I've been to Stable many times and from reading the other reviews, I can see how I differ a bit.  I'm from the east coast so I am used to a bit more 'direct' customer service but I never got the rude vibe.  Maybe other people like the overly cheesy service that, in my opinion, is way more obnoxious than the "hey, how's it going... what can I get you.. anything else?... okay, here's your change, thanks" interaction I've had with the baristas at Stable.

Overall, I recommend this place- just make sure to ask for that side salad :)
author: Milagro J.

description:
I work right down the street from here, so stable cafe USED TO BE my go-to lunch and coffee spot for a year and a half. 
After about 3 months of bringing my own lunch to work (it's hard times, yo!), I recently decided to treat myself and head back to stable for my favorite menu item, the quinoa salad. What I got was not what I expected.

What I got was a measly tuna-can-sized portion of quinoa salad. A 1/4 of what the portion size used to be, at the same price (~$9). The quality was good, but I couldn't enjoy my meal because I was so angry. 

The quality of service and portions are decreasing, and the prices are remaining the same. I am so disappointed. I will never return.
author: Marisa K.

description:
Short: They violate food safety regulations, and they're sloooooow.

Long: It's a good thing so many people have given up on this place, I can't imagine how slow they'd be if everyone who likes the food/coffee actually went there and you had to wait even longer to order. I can't tell you how many people say the same thing to me about this place... "good food/coffee but it takes *forever*!"

There's rarely much of a line there, which gives you a false sense of how long it will take. 

I like the food, generally. However, on several occasions they just pulled one of the hours-old display sandwiches out of the case, heat it up and charge you as if it'd been fresh (part of the price is for freshness and not getting sick from food poisoning, no?)

I'd easily change my rating to a 5 if they hired cooks who knew how to hustle and didn't try to get away with serving me old, contaminated, soggy food from the display case!! It's not just gross and insulting, it's dangerous. The staff have obviously never been trained in food safety. Even BK and McD's throw their food out if it sits around for a fraction of the time Stable thinks is acceptable. I've taken culinary arts classes and know how little time it takes bacteria to grow at room temp... 

I think they're trying to solve their speed problem by cutting food safety corners though. If they try to pull the display model after you order, stop them! Tell them they're nasty, lazy and unsafe for trying to get away with that. It's not just rude, they are risking your health and they need to stop!

If you don't, you'll end up with indigestion - at the very least.

If they can get their stuff together, it'd be nice to see them stay around. Do they not realize how many more people per day they'd serve (and more money they'd make) if the speed of service were improved?? People who like them would stop avoiding them. If I walk in and see more than one person waiting to order, I know I'm in for at least 15 mins and I walk out.
author: Paul E.

description: Really can't beat the outdoor/patio seating. Just stopped here for a quick snack. Coffee and cookie was good. The patio really makes this place special on those nice days in the city.
author: Roger J.

description:
This place reopened on 3/30/15.  The banner on top of this page is incorrect.

They've been closed for several months due to rain damage in December. I didn't think I'd miss them, but i am happy they've returned.  Nice space to hang out and get a coffee in an area that is a little low-traffic and away from stuff in general.

Like the staff, they are personable.  The food is okay and definitely a little pricey, but now and then it's fun to get a little "dressed up."
author: John Paul G.

description: Stable is currently my favorite place in the city. Their coffee is great, and their soups and sandwiches are always delicious. Recently had an asparagus + goat cheese panini. Yum. In addition to the great food, the design and layout is beautiful. The back patio they share with Lila B's is one of the loveliest places in the city.
author: Eliza D.

description: Customer service Amazing!!! I had a 16 cup order and they didn't even flinch. Thank you
author: Pauly H.

description:
Very nice outdoor patio. Preferable atmosphere to Coffee Bar, in my opinion. 

On a weekend morning, however, unless you get there at exactly 9am when they open, the wait can be ridiculously slow.  

Having waited for WAY too long a few times, I think I'm sticking to Atlas Cafe (and the new Blue Bottle at Heath Ceramics.)
author: chloe w.

description:
Let's call it a law of averages.  

Five stars for food - not it's not the most amazing gourmet food on earth, but what they do, they do right.  Their sandwiches, salads, and egg dishes are always amazing.

Two and a half stars for coffee - it isn't amazing gourmet, but it isn't Folgers.  It's coffee.

Usually one star or less for service.  Every time I go in there, the person behind the counter seems confused by what I order, messes up the order of the person in front of me or some other stupid mishap ensues.  If there were a place across the street with the same menu and coffee but better service, this place would be out of business.
author: Jana T.

description:
I really wanted to love her. She was pretty yet approachable, had character and was a bit sassy. As lovable as she was, I just couldn't do it - she was cold. That pretty much sums up the Chilaquiles I was served at Stable Cafe.

Everyone knows the service at Stable Cafe is super slow, so don't visit if you're feeling impatient. Today I was feeling mellow so I decided to visit in search of the excellent egg-on-toast I had here a few weeks back. Unfortunately for me, that dreamy EOT was not on the menu, so I ordered the Chilaquiles with egg. I'm OK with waiting, but I'm not OK with cold food, in particular cold eggs sunny side up. Yuck. 

The sad fact is that I ate it anyway. Why? I just could not brave the slow service twice on one visit. 

I want to love Stable Cafe, but I don't know that I can rally for another date. 

*tips - during a rush grab a table before ordering or you'll be standing around for long time as the place is tiny.
author: Gary C.

description: Standing in line to order is so worth it at this place! Great coffee and amazing pastries. They serve breakfast and lunch and the food is delicious. Hands down favorite treat here is the bacon and Brie scone! The outdoor patio they share with The Cheese School is gorgeous and a great place to relax while dining. Great service too!
author: Sandra B.

description:
I have never had such an amazing panini! But, I've also never had such Terrible service! My boyfriend recommended we come here for a quick bite to eat but he told me "you have to order, I can not Stand the woman behind the counter." I of course rolled my eyes, thinking he was a bit dramatic but after meeting him post-order I cried in agreement! Now let me get something straight, the food, coffee and interior (as well as exterior) was phenomenal!! And would give five stars had I not ordered..
The woman who helped me had a long braided pony tail, which you know, kudos on the hair, but she is the reason I will never return. She had an extremely rude tone and seemed very upset that I was ordering (or breathing for that matter) I asked about a breakfast item and she very Loudly responded "BREAKFAST IS OVER AT TEN"... Okay homegirl sorry I've never been here calm down, I proceed to ask if the quiche is available "the quiche?!? Yes!" Okay... Can I get that and a panini..? "YOU WANT THE QUICHE AND A PANINI?! THE PANINI I SUGGESTED?!" Yea sure.. 
AND THEN, after handing her my card she hands it back, with receipt and pen, but almost drops it as my hands were full and funny thing is there is more than enough counter space to set it on especially since I have to sign which requires a hard surface. Overall I felt very attacked, I felt very attacked for wanting some lunch. Girl needs to calm down, fo real doe.

So thank you for the amazing food and the terrifying service. Luckily there is no shortage of coffee or overpriced food in San Francisco.
author: Bryan H.

description:
I used to come to this café nearly every day, when I was coming to Mission district on a daily basis. I always ordered an espresso or a macchiato ($2.25, if I remember right), which was excellent. The staff was extremely friendly. 

Wifi works well. But, at least on the upper floor, there are no wall sockets. There is also a nice outdoor area. I never had anything to eat, but food seemed very  appetizing. 

I really want to go back to say hello to the guys working there. They must be wondering why I haven't come back again. Being the reason I am not coming to the city.
author: Diego M.

description:
Yummy food, Lousy service. 

40 minute wait for a salad and sandwich? Really?! At a cafe? About 20 minutes after we had placed our order a staff member came out to tell me that they were out of the sandwich I had ordered. Um, okay. I picked another one and it took them an additional 20 minutes to bring that one out ! In the meantime most of the other tables that had come in WAY after us were getting their food. It wasn't even that busy. That being said, the food was pretty good so that almost makes up for it and I may be returning due to the close proximity to my house. They do have a large outdoor patio that I imagine being really nice in the summer.
author: Julia C.

description:
Came here on a Saturday morning, it was slammed! The wait was long, but the workers were going as fast as they could. I got an americano, and it was quite good.
Typical mission hipster crowd. The food looked great, I was feasting with my eyes.
Would love to come back and try some food!
author: David B.

description:
This is just the perfect place for pancakes, bacon and egg lovers.....DELICIOUS!!!!. It can't get better than this, being served strong coffee and hot breakfast early in the morning. They open really early and a good place to sit and watch people in and out usually jockeys, trainers and workers of the stable. Since it's close to the fairground and race track it gets busy during the season. They have just the perfect breakfast menu and the right quantity to kick start your day.

The interiors are periodic and with a lot of furniture sitting there just for the sake of it with no co ordination. Overall not bad a bad place to spend some relaxed time sipping coffee next to horses.
author: Michelle W.

description: Lovely! Stopped in for fresh fruit and oj after yoga. Perfect outdoor garden w lots of greenery.
author: Rachel D.

description:
I love it here. My husband jokes that their breakfast sandwiches are what egg mcmuffins would taste like if McDonalds cared :)

The food is fresh and they have those tasty farm eggs. Everything tastes very fresh and healthy. When this place first opened we went EVERY weekend. The only reason why we don't anymore is because it gets very busy. We always bring our friends from out of town here for breakfast.
author: Tina F.

description:
Worst coffee EVER.  It looked like dirty thrice used dish cleaning water.  I'm grossed out just thinking about it, and they sold it to me for $2.25 for less than 12 oz.  I tried to pour half and half on it to mask the poor quality.  Sadly, I could not overcome this dish water "coffee."  Do yourself a favor and make your own; it will be a 1000x better.  Trust me.

Otherwise, would rather go to La Boulange in Noe Valley or Starbuck's on Mariposa + 17th.

Architecturally, it's a fabulous concept to convert a stable into a cafe -- who knew that was possible, even conceivable?  It does add character to the neighborhood.  But that is the only saving grace about this place.  Otherwise, ditch this place.  1 sad star for this joint.  There's definitely room for improvement here, but regrettably I won't be around to see if there will be a turnaround.  Management, are you listening?
author: Roger R.

description:
Although reviews that take account for variables such as the structural layout, ambiance, food and service, and price are significant, whether a place had served to my purpose for the visit is often what translates into how I make sense of my experience. After getting tips from Yelp about their free wifi, cheap pannini, and generally friendly ambiance, I decided to make a visit and put in a few hours of work. The structural layout came as advertised; it had a cute outdoor seating area next to the café and large windows with a second floor to host laptop users. 

The place is cute and tiny with a long line of people waiting to order that tend to cluster from the entrance to the register. The menu was posted behind the staircase that was invisible until you get to the register. I was attracted to several menu items that included their sandwich items ($8) and their good looking empanadas behind the case. Instantly excited about the prospect of a productive afternoon, I ordered a mushroom and a spinach empanadas ($4.50 each) and pressed coffee ($2.25). It wasn't until I received the food and went upstairs I realized that the café did not have any plugs on the walls and the other laptop users could only stay as long as their battery life would let them. What a bummer. They also ran out of soy--until Monday--so my coffee tasted horrible even with brown sugar added. My empanadas were decent but quite expensive. It was not warm all the way through to the middle, but the fillings were still pretty tasty. I thought it tasted better with the side of smoky chipotle sauce that had a nice kick, but otherwise I wished I had ordered their sandwiches or simply go elsewhere for a better meal.

Service was rushed and I felt compelled to bus my own dishes even when I had already left a tip. My visit was brief as I didn't even bother to break open my laptop. It was a wasted effort as I had to trek across town to find another café to get my work going. I thought their food was decent but not worthwhile when nearby options are better and more affordable.  In the end, the café was not laptop friendly and did not fulfill the purpose of my visit. 2 stars for the experience.
author: Daniel L.

description:
Lousy coffee, rude service......

Closing at 4 pm and being uncivilized about it !
author: Maria C.

description:
Do you like:
-Long lines
-Average food
-Holier than thou attiudes

Then Stable is the place for you. Seriously, 20 minutes for an already brewed coffee and a slice of gross quiche that was already cut and just had to be put in a bag?

My favorite was when this unfortunate woman in front of me ordered a "grande" coffee. Rather than just say "we don't have grande, but we do have xyz" the d-bags behind the counter were like, "what's a grande?" and looked at her like she was a moron and made her describe a grande. They made her feel so bad she actually apologized for going to Starbucks. Who the hell do these people think they are? Get over yourselves!! 

I wish I could personally shut this place down for bad customer service and general jerk-titude. And no, they did nothing whatsoever to slight me, I'm just appalled by what I've seen.

Can I give negative stars?
author: Greg G.

description:
It's ok, not really anything to rave about. Actually I came here and ordered their quinoa salad. They said they would bring it right out. So I sat and waited... and waited... and I was like ok quinoa can be a pain to make on a per order basis ... so I waited. All this time I noticed people coming out with numbers and so then I decided to ask about my order. I was asked if I was sure I ordered too. I kind of felt insulted and then they said they would make it right away. However what happened next was just weird. The server just stood behind me with a plate (not even telling me he was there) and stood there for a bit. I got that odd feeling that I was being stared at looked behind me and he just held it up like here it is. All this without saying a word.  So bizarre.

So I found a new seat. They have a pretty cool setup. A saloon looking place with an upstairs bar overlooking the large doors and the outside seating. Old wooden tables along the walls. Well I thought I might as well try this thing. So the quinoa salad was .... blah? I mean it had a lot of quinoa I think some olives (they had the texture at least but no real taste) and a thing of parsley or something. Not a fan. PowerSource does a better job with such food and cheaper. Anyways with the service being lame and the food being lame I don't think I would be back. But I do think the building and interior looks cool.
author: Greg G.

description:
My mechanic is around the block, and since my car seems to be in the shop pretty much once  a month, I've become a semi-regular, since I like to stop in and get breakfast before I walk on home. 



I likes:
The space is amazing. Outside is nice, airy, pleasant, well thought out, spacious, etc.  Inside feels the same way, when it's not hot outside, which is pretty much never, so that's a positive. 

I like knowing where my food is from, fresh, local, yada yada yada. 
Farm fresh eggs are actually so much tastier than the stuff you get microwaved and schlopped on a breakfast bagel in most other coffee shops that have breakfast.  




Negatives:
Hipster Quotient - quite high, but not as bad as anything near Dolores Park, so it's doable.*  


Service - dude. the people who work here seem nice, if not a little spacy,  but, seriously.   One time, I stepped away from my table to put cream in my coffee, and the guy dumped my entire plate, from which I'd yet to take a single bite, into the bin. He did apologize, and they made me a new one, but they also seemed surprised that I was surprised they had done that. 
Today, I waited in line over 15 minutes for a cuppa coffee, and then they said it would be another three minutes for a fresh cup, and so I got an Americano, and it was gross. I've had those before, and this one made me wish I'd just gone ahead and waited, making it an even 20 minutes. There has to be a happy medium between Starbucks or even Peets and 20 minutes. 

Food: the egg bomba tastes like a giant microwaved egg in the middle of bread. And they didn't have hot sauce.  Granted, this was over a year ago when I ordered it. But I remember being frustrated because they brought me my food but no condiments, and I had ordered Oatmeal for the wee one, and they did not bring milk or brown sugar, and then I had to go in and ask for it, and they had to go find it.  This was when they first opened, so I think they've gotten more organized, but still.   

The overall sense I get is that they say (I hear this in a Joe Pesci voice for some reason: " hey - we have fresh local ingredients of high quality and a beautiful spot, what more do you want from me...service? attention to detail? fuhgetabouit".....

Temperature:

If the sun is out and it's above 70 degrees, you could bring a towel and do a sauna indoors while you wait twenty minutes for your cup of coffee. 






*I could probably figure out a way to chart/graph the very expensive skinny jeans ratio relative to how close you are to Bi-Rite, but there are two problems with that idea - 1: I can't chart or graph in this box. 2. I was an English major, so I'd probably get the math wrong, and math is important when creating charts and ratios, especially related to pricing and quantity of people wearing skinny jeans and recycled 80s ironic hair styles in  a given square block area.
author: Carla G.

description: I went there for breakfast one day and had just simple scrambled eggs and toast - awfully disappointing... not tasty at all, cheap bread and jam... eggs were ordinary... I still go there for lunch - there's this mushroom/goat cheese sandwich that's delish - but breakfast no more!
author: Deborah K.

description: Honey, I shrunk the quinoa salad. The dish has gotten embarrassingly small. It used to be a solid pile of goodness but it's been reduced to the size of a large side dish. And it was seriously lacking in flavor, to boot.
author: who k.

description: Love the outdoor seating area, very quiet and serene.  I 've only been here once, but it's a SF gem
author: Tony T.

description:
While I have only visited Stable Cafe a few times, I can say that i'm officially hooked as they were all within a two week period of discovering this gem. If you're one of those who is on the hunt for a spot with a cool and inspiring ambiance to post up with your laptop and get down to business while still having access to healthy nibbles and excellent coffee then this is the spot for you. 

In addition, the history of this place adds to the strong personality of the space, complete with exposed beams and both indoor and outdoor seating.

While I have only been on weekdays and can say it has definitely been "happening" without being too crowded, I would imagine this place getting super popular on the weekends so be sure to plan accordingly.
author: Paul M.

description: Beautiful space and decor, featuring and promoting local artists and nearby businesses. Good coffee. Nicely tucked a little off the mainstream. However staff are a little unprofessional, not friendly and forgetful--if that could be fixed this place would be practically perfect. $5 minimum...sigh. Also no trash can anywhere in sight?
author: Robin C.

description:
solid breakfast sandwich there. basically an egg in the hole, with a strip of bacon, a strip of brie and a few cherry tomatoes (really wish they gave you like 5...) which can be enjoyed on their fine outside patio area.

something about the eggs make them extra tasty. I suspect some sort of herb and a dash of milk.
author: Misha T.

description:
Please, go ahead! Carefully hand-pick a song from your ipod's obviously fucking extensive library of post-rock, down tempo pitchfork reviewed hipster bullshit while I wait for you to begin making the latte I ordered 5 (yes, 5) minutes ago. You know, we don't all have slack-off jobs where we can just saunter in, helluv late, artfully disheveled and most likely stoned. I mean, that is totally my job...but that isn't the point. Now I know this isn't Starbucks and I appreciate that you make sweet love to every latte you pull, but I don't need you to dim the edison bulbs, pop on some mood music, light a scented candle, pour rose petals all over the espresso machine and go down on it too. Ever heard of a quickie? I need my latte. Fuckin step on it.

I'd like to say I'll never come back here because the service is distant, awkward, and lackadaisical shit...but that ain't true. The coffee is good, my friend works around the corner, and I want to get married in the outdoor area...if, of course,  it were in Healdsburg.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Stable gets two stars from me: one star for a great buildout, with a sunny patio for warm days, and plenty of indoor seating for those all too frequent foggy days. One more star for friendly service. 

Unfortunately, my praise ends there. No egg whites? Why, do you get your eggs from a carton? No splenda, either, so my latte went untouched. I guess I'll have...water for brunch?
author: Paul H.

description: Really cool cafe... like "hipster" cool cafe. But definitely everything I've had there has been quality and delicious. Plus they have a very pretty and spacious outdoor patio that's shared with a nursery - something that looks as if it should be in the Magazine Sunset. It's definitely pricier than most cafes, but once you're there you'll understand why. It's a mix of chic - hip - modern - urban - and  progressive. But for sure, the food and drink are downright excellent. Plus the weekend morning workers are always very friendly and supercool. Definitely thumbs up for me!
author: Luna R.

description:
Grilled veggie sandwich is awesome and, despite the old timey vibe of the place, the quinoa salad tastes as modern as online dating. They also serve baked goods; I don't know if they are baked there, but they sure look as fresh as if they were! The place serves both breakfast and lunch, switching menus at unidentifiable times... 

Also, the door in the bathroom is broken... but the place was laid back enough that an embarrassing moment just might be forgivable...
author: Zoey S.

description: I was out in the city for a casting at Nancy Hayes Casting and couldn't find a park near my location.  A drove around the block several times as this is a busy busy area.  Came across Stable Cafe and had to see what it was.  I saw something unique.  Not only a beautiful and welcoming store front but the business collectives that were situated in the back.  Not only was the Toast, Egg, Bacon, and Brie was the bomb but the businesses made me smile especially since I'm a Entrepreneur at heart.  The Container stole my heart!  I'm going back for all of it!
author: Nenna F.

description:
WORST COFFEE EVER

It was absurdly weak and had "things" floating in it. All for $2.25 for barely 12oz. 'Nuff said!
author: Yvette M.

description:
This a cute place for a lunch date, the portions are a bit small but still priced appropriately. I would say the ingredients are of high quality and taste great overall - I got the Noma with fruit bowl along with a cappuccino and was satisfied.

Also they have a good assortment of dessert cakes and pies to try - outdoor seating is a must on those nice days.
author: B H.

description:
Located in boondocks of the Mission the Stable is a place that once you visit you'll want to share with your friends. The quiches are very good and everybody agrees about the coffee. (yum)

On the Weekends  incredible sweet and savory pies are sold in the back. GET IT
author: Samuel P.

description:
Outdoor patio, free wifi, great coffee, good breakfast selection (egg sandwiches, frittata, oatmeal), very chill vibe... this is a great neighborhood spot. I would come here with a laptop or a friend.... preferably both :)

I only wish that they are open longer on Sundays. But hey Coffee Bar is only a few blocks away for the all-day laptop warriors.
author: V W.

description:
Our server was great.  He was exceptionally friendly, and offered to let me taste a few wines when he observed indecision.  (Wine was excellent.)

Tapas were fun and fresh.  Caramelized onion empanada, heirloom tomato salad with capers, spicy potato frittata, and a small selection of cheeses, fresh fig, and walnuts.

The outdoor space is nice.  They close at 8 though; they are also closed on Sundays.
author: Elizabeth M.

description: Staff was super friendly.  I had the Mixed Green Salad which was huge and great!!!!
author: Heath W.

description:
Don't dare ask for a decaf here.  They'll fling attitude and scoff at you as they did when I first tried it here and as they did today (more than a year later).  Sorry but every other cafe even in the Mission serves decaf in some form so don't look at me like I'm from the moon.  Oh also their snotty barista's will look sideways at you if you have a child with you.  Sorry but you don't get to 'curate' your patrons as you would your tumblr that no one reads mr. hipster.  

Haven't eaten the food but my friend's food today came out wrong.  With the attitude they got at the counter they weren't motivated to send it back.  

The lure of their beautiful space is strong but will be getting no more of my cash.
author: Tommy C.

description: This is my local! Love stopping by here for egg mcmuffins in the morning.
author: Tasha D.

description:
Such a cute coffee shop in the middle of nowhere!  We were attending a Pop Up for Rice Paper Scissors and wanted to get some coffee to warm up after eating outdoors on a gusty San Francisco day.  

THOSE DOORS.  Oh man...  It adds to the overall experience of this cafe.  SO UNIQUE and you know you're going into a place where the owners care about every single detail of your coffee/food experience.  Everything is thoroughly thought out and the workers take pride in what they do.  I love places like this!

The cafe is two floors and has a fun decor and delicious coffee and food menu.  You would think there's plenty of seating since the place is 2 floors plus a back patio but it's definitely a poppin' place and you might be better off taking to go.  

Very modern/trendy type setting and can definitely imagine spending some good quality time there chatting over a cup of coffee or putting in a couple of good study hours time.  They have these neat paintings/artwork and they have unique glass gardens from local artists.  I'm such a fan!  

I ordered a latte and a piece of apple pie from the lady sitting up top with crates....hilarious but perfect for us.  We couldn't get seats so we stood at the bar table and spent a good 20 minutes chit chatting over coffee and apple pie.  

I don't go out this area too often, but if you're in the area I strongly recommend you walk your butt on over just to take a peek.  You'll be pleasantly surprised.
author: Sandy L.

description: Brie Bacon panini with a side salad is a near perfect lunch.  Outdoor garden is great.
author: Steve S.

description:
I made a Quick Tip about this coffee shop a while back and I pretty much stick to it. The space is cool and different then most but the coffee isn't so great and the service is pretty lame.  The guy behind the counter told me he'd be right with me so at least I was acknowledged but then he began to walk around aimlessly without purpose and started finally pouring someones drinks while the guy actually making coffee just stood there.  I don't mind if you're helping someone before me - go for it but do it with vigor as to not create lines.  Once I finally placed my order the "barista" began to chat it up with another patron who had walked in and after waiting 12mins for my drink I began to think they had forgotten about me, but I was wrong.  My drink came up and after all of that it tasted horrible.  It tasted as if the shots had expired from the long wait after pulling and before placing in milk. 

once again the space is cool and they've actually expanded the pastry and food options but without the outside patio and fun modern decor this place would die off quickly and easily be a 1 star in my book.
author: Kevin J.

description: Forget going to Tartine; just go here instead.  A better space, nicer outdoor area, food in the same range of quality, & you don't have to wait in line.  Seems like a no-brainer to me.
author: Mordicai C.

description:
I wish I had not moved away from this Stable Cafe of my dreams.  The outdoor patio is so quaint with scattered tables and little stick trees. It was a place so comfortable and relaxing as I munched on my delicious food and sipped my tasty beverage. I could be perched on my laptop or kindle or chatting idly with friends, you always welcomed me. 

I usually ordered a scrumptious panini (many vegetarian options here) and a michelada or a coffee drink and the oatmeal, but everything looks good that is coming out of the kitchen. I would find myself looking at the items other people ordered and making mental notes to try it next time - like the quinoa salad. 

I was blown away by the people who were work here who are so busy, yet so nice and efficient. And I loved the pie lady outdoors with her little of shop of homemade, original treats.

How I wish oh wish that another cafe could be worth the five lovely yelp stars as yours is, Stable Cafe. I will be making a special trip to you on weekends just because you are such a wonderful cafe dream of mine.
author: Daniella B.

description: My favorite cafe in the city. Sitting in their sunny patio makes working on the weekends just a little sweeter. The environment is like being at a yoga retreat. The coffee is good and the staff gives this place a family vibe. The food is organic and fresh. But don't expect it to be cooked to perfection. It is, afterall, prepared in a cafe.
author: William B.

description:
Great funky atmosphere, super kind staff and YUMMY food. I had the arugula salad ad was blown away by how fresh the cheese was. 

They have wifi and are a good place to hang out on a rainy or sunny day.
author: Heather J.

description: We were here for brunch with friends.  We ordered and sat outside in the patio.  The weather was nice and the patio was very pleasant.  The service was great. One person in our party wanted glutton free meal and they were very helpful and knowledgeable about what on the menu is glutton free and what modifications they could make to make their other dishes glutton free.  The food itself was good but not great.  High marks for friendliness, nice patio on a sunny day, responsive service, and medium score for the dishes that they offer.
author: Farzad G.

description:
Love the upstairs area! Great for getting some work down and watching people come in downstairs. Food is great for lunch, they have outdoor seating and on the weekends you can also examine small jewelry stands and nom some amazing pie! 

I was here on a Sunday and there was some pretty chill live music going on outside. In general, the indoor seating is a bit limited, but a great experience otherwise!
author: Connie C.

description:
Wow! I'm so excited to have found this little cafe. They have a nice sunlit outdoor patio (which is nice on sunny days).

I had a sandwich with asparagus, goat cheese and an egg fried on top. I hate eggs. But this looked (and tasted) so delicious that I gobbled it up and haven't had a day go by where I haven't craved another one. It also came with a fruit salad made of strawberries, bananas and pineapple - not the cheap watered down honeydew fruit salad most places serve. 

The croissant I ordered for my 2-yr old pal was flaky and buttery with crispy crust - yum.

My cappuccino was just as good as a blue bottle or sightglass. 

I am coming back.
author: Katherine B.

description: I'm sitting here at stable right now. I come here every Tuesday morning to enjoy Stable's cute garden, delicious food and decent coffee. Although I consider myself a regular I just can't give more than 2 stars. The prices are on the higher side...I can forgive them for that because the food is great quality. But the staff is just AWFUL. Are the owners hearing this? I come here all the time, not once does the staff, whom I recognize, ever greet me with my smile and they make me feel as if I'm inconveniencing them because I interrupted their insipid conversations and catty remarks about customers and the guy they banged last night. Seriously, put on a smile, even if it's fake and maybe you'll get a bigger tip from me.
author: Leslie T.

description: We had breakfast at the Stables restaurant and we enjoyed it very much. We stepped into a little oasis of a quiet and refreshingly designed atmosphere that let us forget that we are in a big busy city. Breakfast was great and inexpsensive. It was a great experience and a fun place to share breakfast with friends.
author: Guido W.

description:
My boyfriend and I have been coming here quite frequently  for the last year or so and enjoyed it until today.  
We got there around 2:00pm no line at the counter.  The guy in the counter was a short brown hair with facial hair; started talking loud to someone else while taking our order. Then forgot to make our order so my bf had to remind him about it. Once it was ready he didn't bother to let us know even though we were sitting within view. He gaves us the typical stupid hipster attitude as if we had to be sorry for ordering coffee.  The owner of this place needs to do something about his staff. No wonder their ratings are decaying.
author: Giorgio L.

description: Great space and location, but the quality of food leaves something to be desired.  It's mediocre at best.  Both my friend and I had panini sandwiches which were supposed to be accompanied by a side salad - all for $10.  Food arrived and consisted of approximately 5 pieces of lettuce and a drizzling of olive oil along with a costco food-court quality panini.   Ciabatta roll, slice of provolone and a slab of deli chicken.   Very unsatisfying and unappetizing.   The leash less, unattended dog that was allowed to run free in the outdoor patio seating area taking a crap right in front of our table didn't quite help to improve the quality of the experience.   Needs a lot of work and won't plan on returning.
author: Todd K.

description: This place is a go-to for Friday lunches on nice days. I recommend the tomato, mozzarella, and pesto panini. There is a beautiful outdoor seating area. They share the space with the Cheese School, so sometimes it is hard to get a seat. Looking forward to trying this place for breakfast too!
author: Harmony P.

description: Good coffee; relatively slow service (with no wait).  Nice outdoor seating.  I'll go back.
author: Anon M.

description: Same experience as everyone else. Poor service by some seemingly frustrated and bitter hipsters. I'm sure this attitude comes from the owners. I work just around the corner and thought this would be my go to cafe, but who wants to spend money at a place with a rude staff and mediocre food. Beautiful space, fantastic outdoor seating, but seriously, try being happy and treating your customers like they matter.
author: Stephen H.

description: In all candor, I just stopped in here for a drink and to do some work on the top floor, so I can't comment on their food (have heard that it is delicious).  The space itself is really nice, and there is a top level where you can grab a bite/work on some stuff in relative quiet.  On those rare, warm SF days it can get a bit toasty at the very top, but overall a nice place to stop by.
author: Mel G.

description:
At this point, I've been here twice. Both times the coffee was excellent (cappuccino).

The second time we went, we got some breakfast. Got the pomba, I think--the one with toast, brie, egg and bacon. The bread was very very good (and perfectly buttery), very generous on the brie, egg was delicious (but we kinda wished it was just an over easy egg, not scrambled), and bacon was average.

All in all, I'll be coming back here a few more times before I move away from the city. Love the front of the cafe and the design inside is excellent as well. Staff are friendly and quick with service.
author: Angela H.

description: I had the Mate Latte with Almond milk and the barista added honey and it was SO good. I need to know what honey they use, it was amazing.
author: Kaitlyn C.

description:
!!!!   DESPICABLE   !!!!

**** I'M SO FURY, I JUST WANT TO DIE ****

The service was horrible.  After we got our sandwiches we went upstairs to dine. Being my first time here we had no idea it was self cleaning. We left the plates upstairs. Just when we were about to leave, the server opens the door from outside and roared..

"MA'AM MA'AM (rudely) HELLO UH.. YOU NEED TO BRING YOUR PLATES DOWNSTAIRS (while he was smoking a cigarette). IT'S SELF CLEANING (cocky mf  like he is too good for the job). NEXT TIME REMEMBER TO BRING YOUR PLATES DOWNSTAIRS AND CLEAN UP AFTER (looked away and kept smoking)"

Are you out of your flipped out mind, there will be NO NEXT TIME. I am never returning and even if I do I am going to leave an APPALLING MESS for you. 
 
My recommendation is HIRE MINIONS

this happened about 1 year ago...
author: K L.

description:
What an impressionably cute space for a cafe? My first impression is how spacious the backyard area is, perfect for brunch outside on a lovely day like today.

The staff is attentive and friendly.The servings are smaller, nonAmerican sized bites, which is perfect for portion control, and prices are super reasonable.

Good cup of jo and solid cappuccinos.

My friend chose to come here as she needed some "STABLE"-LITY in her life. But come to find out the place used to be a stable, thus the name... Stable Cafe.

Will definitely visit again.
author: Jackie G.

description:
We were disappointed.  This place is close to home, very nice inside and the building has a terrific history.

Sadly the food is mediocre, priced to high for quantity and taste and the service terribly indifferent.   They tout "quality" ingredients and I believe they do use quality ingredients, but ingredients alone don't make a dish.  It requires ingenuity, SEASONING and some heart.  All lacking here. 

We've been three times.  Each visit was consistent with the previous.   This could be a really cool place with a little effort.  We'll try again at some point but won't go out of our way.
author: Russell D.

description:
Stopped in for lunch cause I was working a gig at the ODC Theater down the street and didn't have long to eat. Short line when I got there which was around 12:30 PM on Wednesday. Ordered the soup and salad combo (soup of the day was tomato and salad was a mixed green salad in a vinaigrette with red onion rings, cherry tomatoes and cucumber chunks, also came with 3 pieces of a toasted baguette for the soup) for $7. 
Went outside to the courtyard because the few tables inside were taken and it was adorable outside. Plants everywhere, ample seating and a lot in the shade (thankfully cause it was really hot outside). Got my food in about 6 minutes- everything was really good. The tomato soup was yummy, I only wish they used fresh chives to garnish instead of dried because it would've added a nice flavor. The crostini was great to break up and throw in the soup like croutons. Salad was light and fresh and perfectly dressed. The meal was filling for a lunch dish. 
Water is self serve but the glasses are tiny so it's annoying (especially when hot out) to have to keep getting up and going inside to refill- especially when you're by yourself and have to haul your purse and other belongings with you.
author: Kajal G.

description:
Love this place, servers are super friendly and cute. But they only serve breakfast OR lunch! They won't give u something from the lunch menu at breakfast time and vice versa. Sad face. Also, be warned: they have NO outlets or plugs! Your only option is to charge up in the bathroom lol

feel good spot.
author: Nikki H.

description:
I find that no matter where my gaze lands at Stable Cafe, I face something lovely to behold. This is a quality I demand in a spa or hotel room but have long ago abandoned as attainable in coffee houses.
Some may say they charge too much; I say, pay attention to detail. There is good salt in that lavender cookie. This painting inspires me to write. The handsome barista performs his duties behind a fine counter and in an appetizing-looking kitchen space.
Good service, coffee, and menu make it a perfect place to write. One star deducted for a shortage of electrical outlets and inconveniently short hours of operation.
author: Kristy L.

description:
Me (8 months pregnant and thus avoiding my normal caffeine fix): good morning!  Can I please have a decaf coffee?

Guy at counter: (annoyed) we don't have decaf. (silent stare)

Me: oh, ok. Would you by chance have decaf espresso instead? I could go for an americano.

Guy at counter: (slowly articulating) WE. DON'T. HAVE. DECAF. 

No one should be treated the way the guys at stable treat their customers.  And my opinion of the place is a common one amongst our friends who have also left there feeling abused. 

It's a pity because it's our local neighborhood spot... But after several mornings of mistreatment, we (and many of our neighbors) walk a few extra blocks to avoid it. 

I think the spot is architected beautifully, love the outdoor patio, like the espresso and snacks.  The owner would do well to hire a new, friendlier staff.
author: Anjali J.

description:
Went to Stable Cafe for the first time while visiting family and was pleasantly surprised!

The Cafe kind of sneaks up on you in this neighborhood... but a great addition.

I had the vegetarian sandwich and it was wonderful  :) I loved the portobella mushroom, roasted red bell peppers but especially loved the spears of asparagus... yummm.

It was served with a nice portion of green salad, all-in-all it was well worth the $8.50.

Some have commented on the wait time, we got our lunches really quickly and sat outside.

The only odd thing was they didn't serve any decaf coffee, so we had iced Chai and a mango juice.
author: Roxanne G.

description: Really cool spot - architecturally. Good tortilla omelette. Good coffee.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Stable Cafe is so incredibly cute, I almost don't want to yelp about it...

Whoever designed the space is a genius. If I owned a coffee shop (dream job), I would want it to look like Stable. Rustic meets modern, with huge windowed doors and lots of sunlight. It's small and cozy with a killer patio space on the side - can't wait to enjoy it when the weather's nice again! A little history lesson as well: This building was originally the carriage house of James Phelan, former San Francisco mayor (elected in 1897). Neat.

Love local? They use NorCal produce, have pictures of the chickens that lay their eggs (Portlandia, anyone?), and they brew De La Paz coffee, small batch beans roasted right there in the Mission!

Although the food looks gorgeous, it could taste a little better - I think they're probably doing the best they can with such a small kitchen space. I've only had a quiche and a salad. I've got my eyes on brunch though, so I'll be back to try more soon :)

Note: Seems like it gets pretty busy, so try to go during off hours - last time, I couldn't get a seat!
author: Stephanie P.

description: They take the average cup of coffee and make it extraordinary. They have a big patio area and an upstairs that give you a lot of options for dining in.
author: Mike P.

description:
So much to love.  Where to begin?

First of all, I am a fallen coffee snob. I drank coffee and cared about it then stopped drinking coffee and stopped caring about it.  Fast forward to graduate school and I now care about coffee again.  Very much so.  

So how pleased was I to discover this lovely space a few blocks from my house?  Ridiculously pleased!

I get either a machiatto or an americano. If my tummy is grumbling, I get the oatmeal that comes with plenty of fresh fruit and granola for a little texture.  I haven't tried any of the other food but it all looks and smells delicious.   Friends of mine who have tried the simple egg sandwich and the quiche have said they are yummy.  Even my ex, who has always cared about coffee, said it was the best machiatto he has ever had.

Also, they have beer and wine, a garden, an upstairs seating area which is good for getting a little work done and some outdoor tables as well.

But most importantly for a coffee shop in the mission, it has two of the cutest baristas ever.  Both tattooed, both the perfect blend of not too slender and not too muscled. One tall and one short, one male and one female.  They made this reviewer hungry for more than Stable Cafe's delicious oatmeal.
author: Fia M.

description:
Stable brews De La Paz coffee and it's really good. Really really good. 

I also ordered a chicken sandwich which was had well toasted bread and yadda yadda ok who cares about the sandwich, lets go back to talking about the coffee. Get the frenchpressedbrew, bring a book, and just sit for a while. Refills are free. But you won't be able to handle more than two cups. You'll be wired. Its good. Damn good. Before I left I bought a bag of the Perfume V beans and took them home with me.  Normally I finish off a bag of beans in a few months... but not these beans.  They were gone in a few weeks.

The ambiance at Stable is quite nice too. Seating on two levels, huge windows so you get lots of mission sun, wooden tables and chairs.  It's a great place to hang out for a while and get some work done.

The location is a bit off from the main mission hangouts and the hours are a bit of a downer - they close by four. Stable, stay open and serve that coffee all day long. Actually it may be a good thing they close by four - I'd would never be able to fall asleep from all the caffeine if they stayed open any later.

On a side note the staff there is a bit hipster-douchey, but they do make the coffee so I suppose they are allowed to be that way.
author: Samir C.

description: In a town overrun with trendy "fresh from our farm" food, service is key. While the fare at Stable Cafe is decent it's nothing to write home about, especially when served up by a rude douche bag with zero hospitality skills. Next time I'll patronize an establishment where the waiter understands that the right response to, " I also ordered an iced chai," is not, "um yeah it's up on the counter."
author: Wrenay C.

description: Ahhh love it, and need to come back when I can actually enjoy the outside patio area.  The inside is cute w/ interesting art on the walls, and the food looks amazing. Definitely worth a stop if in the area!
author: Sonya D.

description: Make sure you are not in a hurry whenever you come to this place. It's worth the wait but there is one on all items any day of the week.
author: Nicole O.

description: Went there for lunch and had such a good time. The atmosphere is very cool, and I love the outside area. The staff was so nice and I ordered a new latte that I have not tried before. The lady said that I if I did not like it, she would make me a regular latte. And I did not like it, so she just made me a new coffee. Good service!! Also, I had a salami panini which was very good. My friends and I sat there for a long time, even after they closed, but no one rushed us out. Very nice people. I even got to borrow on of the staff's charger to charge my phone.
author: Sigrid E.

description:
I had high hopes for this place.  It was recommended as a great brunch spot. On first try, I loved the concept.  The design and atmosphere were fantastic and I liked the menu written on the newsprint.  

The food however, was very bland. I thought perhaps I had ordered poorly, so I gave it one more shot.  This time, I went back for brunch with friends who were visiting.

The quiche was tasty but everyone else was disappointed with their food.  The breakfast sandwich was incredibly dry and the eggs in the hole left a lot to be desired.  Our french press drinker was unhappy with his cup.  The cappuccinos and hot chocolates were a hit.

It sounds like other reviewers really enjoyed the lunch menu, so I may be back to test the lunch.    I am really hoping they learn to spice up their breakfast a bit.... this place has potential.
author: Melanie R.
