Perhaps it is nice to come here if you are planning to hang out as the space is attractive, but it is no where to go to get something to go.
author: Julia W.

description:
i like the fact that they have the following: french press coffee (gimme the grit), coffee refills, outside patio, free wifi.

the food was good and priced within reason. i had a potato and egg quiche.
author: Ameer N.

description:
Cool setup, nice interior, friendly service. I was debating between the roast beef and grilled chicken sandwich--one of life's core dilemmas--and went with the roast beef on walnut bread on a recommendation from the guy at the counter. Apparently everything here is made here. Even the beef was roasted here.

The sandwich was awesome and put an exclamation point on a sunny afternoon in Dolores Park.
author: Hiten P.

description:
After my tattoo session, I needed a place to go for a bit.  Someone recommended Stable Cafe, which was only a block away. 
I was going to order a sandwich, which is usually the safe bet, but the guy at the counter suggested the Quiche. I've never eaten that before, but he made is sound real appetizing, so I went with that.  It was very good, and I'm happy that I ordered that. Now I probably will compare all Quiche's to this one. 

I totally like the chill vibe, with the free wi-fi, and the workers are real cool, super nice. 
I would definitely come back here if I was in the area.
author: Peter K.

description: Beautifully laid-out cafe in an area of old cafes in old buildings, this place rocks with modern clean new lines with lots of wood, with a unique touch to their single uni-sex bathroom. Love the Stable's mood and will definitely return if I am ever in SF again!!! Check out the "small" front doors!!!!
author: Tony L.

description: Stable cafe is nice and it adds a lot to the neighborhood and the city's architectural appreciation scene, but it sometimes feels like they are not very interested in the task at hand, which is running a cafe and serving paying customers. Maybe most people coming in are hip-enough to appreciate being snubbed. I can appreciate the notable addition to the block and I would like for them to be successful and stick around for a long time, but there is definitely room for improvement in the customer alienation department.
author: Jeni K.

description:
I always feel like an obsequious bell-end when I snack at Stable because I rave about everything I try.  
Really loudly.  
It's like my filter shuts off when I walk through the large glass door.  
Inside voice becomes outside voice - obnoxious running commentary about the quality of what I'm consuming as it's being consumed.

Admittedly, I haven't tried the sandwiches but the coffee is first rate and they have these delicious gourmet empanadas which blow my mind.  

Now, the most important bit: baked goods.  9 times out of 10, when you walk into a bakery, pastry shop, cookie store - whatever - and shit looks amazing...it usually falls short of expectations.  You imagine how good something's going to taste and then it doesn't.  This is not the case with this joint.  From cookies to blondies to caramel nut squares, they nail it every time.

Gorgeous space.  Lots of light.  Lovely place to kill some time with a paper and coffee.

Bonus points for great service too.  The guy behind the counter is really friendly and helpful.
author: David K.

description: Simply the best Veggie Panini in the City!    Fresh asparagus, goat's cheese, pesto....grilled.......orgasmic...SERIOUSLY.  (and I'm a meat eater...so take it for what it's worth)
author: Blake J.

description: This place is definitely worth checking out! I love their huge glass door and how spacious and bright it is once you walk inside. The counter is directly in front of you and there's seating on both levels and outside. The person behind the counter was really friendly and my food was brought to me pretty quickly. I got the turkey and Swiss panini which came with a small side salad. The bread was warm and crunchy and the cheese was melted over the turkey and was a bit crispy on the outside (just the way I like it). My friend got the Quinoa Salad and soup of the day. The presentation was nice, but the salad was a little bland for my taste. Next time I'll come back to try their Wild Arugula salad. Another thing, they display art from various artists on their walls so you get some visual stimulation during your meal.
author: Danielle W.

description:
After several evening walk-bys, I finally got to check this place out when it was open during Open Studios this past weekend. I've now been 3 times in as many days. Despite the fact that my daily commute takes me past several coffee/pastry gems in the Mission, Stable is my new favorite.

Whoever designed and decorated this space is a genius. From the moment I walked in the door and saw three Blair Bradshaw paintings hanging up in the loft, I was in love. Great coffee, yummy pastries, tasty fresh fruit, wonderful ingredients. Every little detail puts a smile on my grumpy morning face. There's nothing not to love about this place. 

Except the yogurt. The yogurt I had there yesterday turned my smile upside down. Granola & fruit on top were tasty. Bad yogurt is a minor flaw. So I'm just going to cross my fingers and hope they jump on the Straus yogurt train in the near future. Because I'd like Stable to be a regular stop on my commute. 

I'm also going to hope that the hours really will be expanding soon.

Can't wait to try the rest of the food, it looks/sounds delicious!
author: Becah D.

description:
this place is cool by me. the boys that work there are cute, and they have good food n stuff. 
sometimes the salads are a little "kitchen floor" for my taste...but it's near ODC, is aesthetically pleasing, and has agua fresca. 
works for me.
author: M T.

description:
Stable as gradually but surely become a regular stop on my way to work for a latte (or, more usually, two lattes - I carpool with a coworker and pick up her coffee before I get her.  So this review really contains *two* stamps of approval!).  I've not tried any of their foods besides the lavender sea salt shortbread (mmmmmmmmm), but the coffee is top-notch.  I've had a few unfortunate lattes from them as they train a few new staff members, but I'm willing to forgive that.  The people who work here are charming, by the way, and I'm just waiting for day when I need to sit in a coffee shop and work for awhile.  So far it's been all to-go for me, alas.

I DO wish they were open before 8, though, for those days when I have to be at work early.  7 AM is not unreasonable to wish for a coffee shop to be open, is it? The other thing that would be awesome is really GOOD chai (hopefully more consistent than Coffee Bar's unfortunate frequently-gritty often-unavailable offering).
author: Jess L.

description:
First time in I had tea (Mighty Leaf - excellent), not coffee, but the java smelled sweet and dark so I'm guessing it's good.  Great vibe, very chill, low-key decor, down-tempo music at a volume where you can have a reliable conversation and great food.  WiFi but no power outlets, super friendly staff, lovely upstairs with a view.  Gets busy at 1 as the local office peeps come in for lunch and a quick coffee. 

Highly recommend, will be back.
author: Troy S.

description:
So the coffee was decent until the slowest hipster barrista took 14 minutes to bring it to me from the enormous distance of 3' from where the machine is. I timed my last visit there, just to be especially dickish, i timed the whole transaction. I wondered if it was me just feeling that I wasn't cool enough and was uncomfortable or if it actually did take an eternity for the four guys behind the counter to figure out how to toast a pastry and put it on a plate along with a cup of coffee. Well after what seemed like 15 minutes I looked at the timer clock on my I phone (see I'm hip I'm cool I have the I phone, yes its only an Iphone 4)  and behold we were rolling up on 12 minutes. Considering this information I figured out that I was actually cool, it wasn't me feeling uncomfortable, it actually was taking an eternity to get a cup of coffee. DONT MESS WITH MY COFFEE, GIVE ME COFFEE, just pour that black magic into a cup and hand it over to me. All the boys behind the counter sure are pretty, its like Zoolander opened a cafe with a bunch of condescending coffee jockeys. I also was concerened about the extremely thin v necks that the majority of the staff seems to sport and the inevitability of a short and curly man fluff topping off my coffee. The staff here needs a serious hipster-ectomy and some god damned courtesy.  I take heart that I do not have to visit this establishment since there are 2 wonderfully staffed shops within 2 blocks of this place. Stable does have a pleasant courtyard and decent entrees, but all in all I felt like I stepped in horse crap when I left 20 minutes later with coffee made by someone who found a way to infuse contempt, and general apathy into a cup.
    Get on your horse and stable it somewhere else.
author: Atom H.

description: Eggs will never be the same to me again. As someone who is quite fond of breakfast, I've always held a great respect for eggs and the ways in which they can be prepared. But Stable Cafe has changed the way I think about them, from the quality of the egg itself to how it's cooked to its presentation. I now strive to emulate the superb breakfasts that Stable provides. And they provide them with a big smile and demand not a lot of money. Not to mention it's located in an area that's generally sunnier than others. Stable's modern renovation of a warehouse has a lovely ambiance, and the outdoor patio is very dog-friendly and somewhat secluded from the street. I will be going back. Frequently.
author: Justin M.

description:
I wish I were more eloquent to do this place justice.
I had the quinoa salad. It was AMAZING!!!

With every bite you can taste the grilled (yes grilled) vegetables (peppers, zucchini, other stuff I don't even know). I'm a meat-eater, so I thought "Quinoa?? Come on... I need some meat!", so I ordered a side of chicken. And hardly touched it, cuz I was so engrossed in eating the salad (yes, it's that good!)

The cappuccino I had was great too. Service was very friendly and neighborly. Light and jokey. Fun.

Plenty of inside and outside seating.

I will definitely be back. 
I'm kindof a food snob, and this place killed it in the "amazing food" department. And it's just a low-key, comfy cafe'
author: Rich M.

description:
Stable Cafe is literally our second home and we are soooo happy they opened half a block from our home.  Sit outside in the sun on the patio, under gorgeous orange umbrellas if you are on a sun worshipper, or directly in the sun if you are.  Sit on the sidewalk and watch the crazy world pass you by or sit inside the cool interior and marvel at the work they have have done to make an open, inviting place to meet with friends or sit alone reading or on your laptop (free wifi)....
Excellent coffee from our local Mission roaster, De La Paz coffee...all good coffee start with only the best grounds but it does not end there, we have had De La Paz elsewhere and it isn't half as good, you need a barista that loves making coffee and they have them, Davide and Matt take their time with your shot and you taste it in every sip.

Then the food, which is not only prepared with the freshest, local ingredients, it is prepared with love and presented in breathtaking fashion...a delight for the palate and almost everyone seems to order food...

And the kitchen...immaculate with the most friendly staff - good people attract good people and the owner Tomas (and his partner, the architect) is one of THE most beautiful and dedicated people we have had the pleasure to meet, treats his staff well and they treat him, the cafe and us as the customer with so much love and respect....

And it is more than just a cafe, they rent the kitchen space to several small, local businesses who sell their goods their...

Wow, a great space that is creating community within the community so if you haven't tried it get yourself and your friends down there and have an experience you are happy to pay for, your body will thank you too.

yes, we love the Stable and you will too...
author: shivie c.

description:
YES! YES! YES!  This place is winning my foodie heart over. I could eat here every day and not get sick of it. Plus they don't even stock mayo. It is healthy, fresh, yummy, and some of the best fucking lunch food I've ever had in my life.  

its okay if they take awhile, you can taste the love in the food.
author: Stella L.

description: I'd rate this place as average. There don't seem to be very many other coffee shops in this neighborhood. I've gone there a few times. Once they were mysteriously closed. Other times, they have been reasonably busy. There is not too much seating, but I haven't had a problem finding a seat.
author: Mimi B.

description: Really nice space and great food, but I was really surprised that the front cashier guy was such a jerk, giving me completely unprovoked attitude in response to a simple question about the menu. Total turnoff.
author: Daniel B.

description:
I am house sitting at a friends this week and discovered Sable Cafe while walking my dog around the corner. Thanks god, for this place. The 17th and Shotwell area leaves much to be desired for coffee and food. 
   Stable is very clean and modern. I love the very unpretentious butcher paper menu and nice selection of baked goods. I had a soy latte that was on the same level as Blue Bottle and a cranberry ginger scone. $4.75! what a deal. I can't wait to try the lunch selection.
author: Douggers M.

description:
Say what you will about hipsters, but damn do they know how to make coffee. Haters gonna hate. 

Coffee was excellent, although maybe it's just the latte art skewing my perception. I got a leaf. Cool. 

There's a lot of seating but I couldn't find any power outlets. Bummer. I really enjoyed the ambiance and the decor (definitely beats Applebee's). Sitting in here at 10am with the sun streaming in through giant glass windows is quite pleasant. I'm bringing a book or journal if I'm ever back for non-work reasons. 

Price: OK, a little pricey. But if you're not a dirty latte-sipping liberal like me you probably wouldn't pay more than $2 for a cup of coffee anyway, and this isn't your spot. I for one am perfectly fine with it.
author: Victor L.

description: great place if you want a healthy lunch. Love the outdoor seating and the food is always fresh and local...i live across town but ill make the trip to the stable no problem. there needs to be more places like this one in sf.
author: Ruca R.

description:
My friend and I had decided to check out this place recently. It's not a very far walk from our work, and we have both seen this place. At one time I even thought it was some new fandangled design company. It's definitely cool looking from the outside.

We go in and it's a lot smaller on the inside than it appears to be on the outside. There is a tiny area up front with a couple tables and then the upstairs with a row of tables. They sure do have that stable feeling down.

When we got there, the menu written on brown construction paper, listed several items, one of them was the "meat sandwich." Meat sounded good at that moment, and there was some allure in ordering something that was so ambiguously titled. I ordered it with "extra meat" and "cheese." The guy at the counter was nice enough to tell me what "meats" I could select from. I ordered roast beef.

For a brief moment after we ordered he had trouble with the cash register, I felt bad for him because obviously the machine was not cooperating. Two girls walked in but left I guess from the wait due to the malfunctioning register.

But eventually he got things under control. And I paid for my meal and waited upstairs with my friend.

The sandwich itself wasn't bad, roast beef with brie, in fact it was really good but the sandwich was on the small side. For the price I expected something large, something that could at least completely satisfy my hunger.

Included were leafy greens topped off with a single cherry tomato which was thoughtful but there could have been more thought put into it. Maybe a couple onions, i don't know, it just seemed so "plain."

Overall not bad, they seem like they're still getting their footing, the sandwich wasn't bad. I'll probably be back for lunch again. Anything topped with brie is brilliant in my book.
author: Carlo F.

description:
yum yum gimme sum!

I had the piaf -- which was a lovely fresh tomato baked, then brie melted on that and then topped with an egg.  It was the perfect size and a good price at $4.50.  I'm super psyched to find a yum breakfast item with no bread and just my size.

They also had egg in a hole with bacon on the menu.  I LOVE egg in a hole!

Friendly service, great space, around the corner from work.
author: Johanna w.

description: Not only is it awesome, great food, friendly staff, inside and outside seating, but it is very well priced as well! I am super excited about making this my primary breakfast/brunch place.
author: Alex W.

description: Great espresso drinks. I like the egg on flatbread food item (thought the knives could be sharper), and the cookie options. Decent amount of seating, especially if the weather is nice.
author: Lion G.

description: The coffee is great and the atmosphere is wonderful.  There was a guy playing classical guitar for everyone when I went.  My only complaint is that they don't have any power outlets.  I had planned on spending the whole day there with my laptop getting some work done.  Hopefully they will get some soon.
author: Allan H.

description:
i used to live in this building. the new owners did such an amazing job retro fitting it. they turned an ugly barn into a beautiful multifunctional building!

the commercial kitchen in the back provides fresh pastries and baked goods every day. they even have freshly roasted granola!

they truly understand coffee brewing, the prices are super reasonable, friendly staff and the salads looked soooo yummie...
author: jasmine h.

description:
Finally had a chance to try this place out and may I just echo the sentiments of other yelpers and say "WOW."  

Beautiful space, very nice people, GREAT food!  I wasn't sure what to think about daily special "Italian Style Meatloaf" for a Friday lunch, but since the paninis weren't really ringing my bell I figured the meatloaf was the better option.  

Boy, am I glad I went that way.  Every single bite of the meatloaf was followed by an "oh my god, I can't believe how good this is!"  Every. single. bite.  Couldn't help myself!  Really!  Anyway, I truly believe that was the best meatloaf I have ever had.  No joke.  

Accompanying the ML was a small mixed greens (perfectly dressed) and some cold-ish green beans tossed in (I guess) olive oil and some herbage.  Also terrific.  Finished every morsel on my plate. 

Did not try the coffee nor the watermelon agua fresca.  They have Mexi-cokes which is ALWAYS a plus.  

Will definitely definitely return.  Thanks Stable!!  

Oh yes, and apparently once they get their liquor license they will expand the hours and start offering tapas and stuff for later.  Also live music?  Flamenco I heard?  Cool.
author: chris m.

description:
Wow. No really, Stable Cafe is a great example of the changing (for the better) coffee scene in the Mission. Everything, from the beautiful wood interior, great lighting, friendly staff, absolutely top notch coffee, crisp bagels... to the icing on the cake - the best vibe around - is fantastic. I'm actually sitting here right now writing this review. And don't worry, not a gut reaction, I was here yesterday too. 

And just as an aside, it is great to now have so many good coffee options: Ritual (crowded though), Atlas (try the Equator Blend), 4 Barrels (try something with the ultra creamy milk), and now Stable (the richest french press around). I've lived here almost 10 years and remember when only Muddy Waters was serving it up, yikes.
author: Chris G.

description:
The Stable is a remarkable operation. The staff is friendly and capable_great service. The Cafe is always clean. The architecture and artwork are interesting. They support/prefer local suppliers for their kitchen(...and aim to make that orientation even more so).
  My favorite lunch special is the Cuban Pork Sandwich with side salad. Scrumptous,delicious,recommended...but save some for me,thank you.
author: Curtis H.

description: Yes -- as others noted, a cool space. Too bad they're not bigger because they'd get even more businesss. Only other downside is that they're not open late -- it'd be a great place to hang and write into the night. Otherwise great food, great drinks, good looking hostess at the counter, good service -- the list goes on.
author: Dan E.

description: The food and atmosphere were great. The staff made the experience there embarrassing and not good. I had ordered the quinoa salad with no cheese, than asked if the soup was vegan. Another staff member came up yelling that "Nothing here is vegan." He said there was no meat or dairy in the dishes, but "The Chef's hand may have touched cheese today". What kind of hipster d-bags are these staff members that they would make me feel embarrassed to ask if something is vegan and make me feel embarrassed to eat a quinoa salad that is apparently vegan but not vegan enough? And do they not wash their hands or keep the place clean? He could have just said 'yes but there may be a little bit of cross contamination' and let me decide for myself instead of making me feel like I should not be eating this salad at all. Maybe the owner should send them back to customer service training.  I really just wanted to get out of there after that because it made everyone I was with uncomfortable.
author: Lindsey L.

description: It may have something to do with it being harvest season but this place served me up the best roasted vegetable sandwich I've ever had. All the quality ingredients, different textures that I could hope for served up in a hurry. I was just running errands but found a new favorite on the way...
author: Charlie S.

description: I like this place for lunch and yummy cookies
author: Samer A.

description:
I think this cafe recently opened and I was excited to try as I had been tiring of the choices by my offices. Great Menu, friendly staff and more importantly YUMMY food!!

Check it out :D
author: Kirsty E.

description: Aloof behomian dicks really pair nicely with my breakfast sandwich.  Each time I return (about once a month because i remember that they have a nice courtyard and a well designed space) they have somehow changed the service staff to another ungracious and seemingly self-righteous stylish fellow.  Way to go.  You've consistently been the only staff in SF that makes me regret tipping.  The stars are for the space and pretty good food.
author: Benjamin M.

description:
Just started going to the place yesterday. it's on my way to work, and a friend works in the building in the offices above the cafe. So I stopped in to visit him, and got a iced coffee and a breakfast sandwich (not scribbled on the butcher paper menu), which is a personal favorite of mine. They use super thick and hearty wheat bread toast, and scrambled eggs with herbs, and white cheddar. The bacon smelled super good too, but I abstained that day. 

Yet, I selfishly don't want to write too good a review for fear that this little gem will blow up into a full blown diamond and I'll have to wait in 20 minute lines for a latte. 

Staff is super friendly as well. But, not in an uncomfortable insincere way, as another yelper already pointed out.

Ch-ch-check it out y'all!
author: Kate R.

description: This is my favorite cafe, with wonderful coffee and a great open atmosphere. It doesn't have power outlets, which I've found welcoming. Be sure to try a sandwich or something, as they're outstanding.
author: Mark H.

description: Review based solely on this: You have GOT to be goddamn kidding yourselves: $9 for a side of quinoa that you're going to call a "salad"? Really? Is that because you're paying the guy at the counter a living wage so he can afford his rent in the Mission? Because that's the only way I can conceive that you justify this ridiculous price. Never again. (The guy at the counter was very nice, however.)
author: Tabatha Y.

description: What an amazing job the owners of Stable have done with that building. The atmosphere is modern and cozy, the coffee strong and delicious, and the food  is all house-made and tasty. This place is an appreciated improvement to this neighborhood. Don't miss it!
author: Libby T.

description:
My friend and I went into 4 Barrel the other day, only to be told they only accept cash.  We walked out the door pretending to go to the ATM, but really got back in the car and headed to Stable.  They'd both been bookmarked forever, so I didn't really care which one we went to, I wanted to try them both.
Stable does French press coffee and a great selection of food items, not just bagels and muffins.  My friend and I split a piece of quiche and the yogurt with fruit and granola.  The piece of quiche was quite small and not as good as the one I make, but the yogurt was really great.  It came with homemade granola, raspberries, bananas, and blueberries.  Stable was pretty quiet, being that it's off the beaten path on Folsom.  There were some students working on homework and a couple people reading the paper. 
I'm docking them a star because they close at 4.  I will never be able to come here on a regular basis.
author: Sarah M.

description: Thomas raises his own free-range chickens for eggs and grows his own fruit trees and tomatoes to serve the best for his customers. It's the love of food and the sustainable source for what we put inside our body that stands out in this cute well-lit cafe.
author: Errol F.

description: I'm sad to write such a bad review because there are a lot of good things about Stable and it has so much potential, but they consistently botch up every single order, each time I go there. It happens EVERY time, without fail.  So after my last visit, I decided to write this review. I ordered the ham and cheese quiche to go and they brought me the veggie quiche to eat in. My screw up was that I didn't look at the quiche before I left because I just assumed it was ham and cheese (I had my finicky kid with me who won't eat the veggie one...). Once they finally packaged it up for me, I left with my quiche.  Once I opened it, I discovered that it was the veggie and not the ham. Not a horrible crime, but annoying.  I also ordered the chocolate mint cookie to go and, without checking, put it in my purse while I was standing at the register.  When I got home, excited to eat the mint chocolate cookie I have heard such good things about, I discovered that they had given me chocolate chip instead of chocolate mint.  Again, not the worst crime in the world, but grrr.
author: Joanna P.

description: If I owned my own coffee shop, this is exactly how I would want it to be. The space is beautiful, the coffee is great, staff is super nice, and free wifi! It also helps that Stable isn't really where anyone would expect to find a coffee shop, so it is pretty quiet and easy to get a table (though it did get pretty busy at lunch time). Just make sure your computer is fully charged as there are no outlets.
author: Emily F.

description: First of all, no decaf.  At all.  Second of all, rude about communicating the fact that there was no decaf and not offering any alternative options.  Wow.  Was very surprised as this place was highly recommended by a friend.
author: Bronagh H.

description: What's not to love? Delicious food, great coffee, friendly staff, distinctive and awesome physical space in an old carriage house. It's hard not to go here every weekend!
author: Tim D.

description: This space is amazing!  We went here for a private party which was held in the back room.  The art on the walls was fantastic and most importantly, every food item that was served was so delicious!  The chef rocks!
author: Dana D.

description: Beautiful space (indoors and out).  Although, I have to say that the last couple of times I have been there, the coffee has been pretty sub-par.  Still, it is charming spot that deserves a try (or several).
author: Jacob L.

description:
I wandered in here for lunch, and well....I feel guilty not giving it 5 stars....but..... 
The food selection is limited, as in maybe 3 kinds of paninis, 2 sandwiches and 2 salads....my arugula salad was $8.50, arugula, sliced apples and two pieces of walnut bread.....little steep. It was a yummy salad, but I don't think people are coming here for the food alone, the atmosphere is very hip/chic. 
The staff is super friendly, but not having someone to bus the tables....eh....I had to clear someone elses plates so we could have a clean table...minus points there. 
The lavender sea salt shortbread was delish! Combined with my cappuccino, I was a happy camper. 
Service was on the slow side, and if you are trying to eat and get back to the office in an hour, this is not the place to go. 
The space is beautiful and open, and if I wanted to work on my computer or read a good book for a couple of hours, I'd probly come here and enjoy another cappuccino and shortbread.
author: Bianca L.

description: This stable-to-high-ceilinged small café is casually and quietly gorgeous with lots of plant art and wood accents; a fine little oasis on Folsom - who knew?! Found it after ODC class nearby and want to go every time I am nearby. Even went three time in one day! Great place to pass some time talking, eating and sipping coffee inside or in the landscaped, shady side alley that seems a bit out of context for the urban hardscape surroundings.  It is oddly tranquil. No problem with service - in fact, the folks have always been super friendly and, importantly, they practice the rare art of decorating the foam on their cappuccinos with intricate designs!  The menu is not too large, but really good. The pies sold by Three Babes are excellent, if a bit pricey. Finally, the side yard alley ends in the entry court for Saison, possibly the most expensive --yet rustic looking -- restaurant in SF. Haven't eaten there and probably never will be able to!!  Ends the alley in a beautiful light filled room that looks like a plant nursery.
author: Joanna C.

description: Love the concept and the enoooormous front door! I only popped in here for a cup of coffee but the joe was good and the vibe was chill. A bit off the beaten path and not much foot traffic on that block but they should fare just fine as the area becomes more gentrified. If I didn't have a job and could bum around in cafes all day with my macbook, I would definitely work this into the rotation with Coffee Bar and L's.
author: Susan L.

description: I don't even know where to begin on this one.  Very San Francisco....trying hard to the idea of something else.  Trying to be old world, but not even coming close to the concept.  The counter man was evasive and then charged my friends for 3 drinks when they only ordered two. The food tastes boring and made somewhere else.  There is no creativity or passion here.  The coffee is terrible and when I asked for a decaf anything I was told "That's not our thing."  Okay.  Really. What is your thing?  There is nothing there worth seeing, tasting or soaking in.  Oh and bonus.  The place leaks..not just here and there, but all over you continually as your trying to escape the relentless rain outside and it's kinda awful.  Oh and there are no lights in the bathroom.  Just one dim candle.  Last time I checked, people like to be able to aim in the toilet, wash their hands and leave the place somewhat respectable.  I could not even see my hands.  It smelled like a stable if that is what they are going for in there, then they have succeeded.  Please don't be mistaken...This is not a coffee bar or restaurant.
author: Amy H.

description: GOD i love this place!  seriously, everything here is amazing.  am gonna check out their night time tapas and drink scene soon!
author: Kimby T.

description: Simple and sweet.  Food is great... prices not so much.  Love that everything is Mission style local.
author: Sas C.

description:
3 stars is the average of 5 stars and 1 star. 

when they're good, they're great; they've made cappuccinos that are the best i've had in the city. they've also made ones with no foam, too bitter, and with a weird metallic flavor. there are more of the latter than the former.

the food is inconsistent. i've gotten the oatmeal with fruit, and it was cold and the berries were moldy. i've also gotten incredibly mediocre sandwiches, and the empanada i was served today was among the worst i've ever had (lord knows i've had a lot of empanadas in my day). it was served cold to boot, and when i mentioned this i was offered a free coffee on my next visit; OK response, but a little weak.

on the other hand, the granola with yogurt and fruit was so good that i am still craving it. ditto on the breakfast burrito. the quinoa salad is also very very good.

the service is identically hit and miss. some days extremely friendly, some days incredibly aloof. they all have the habit of not making any eye contact until they are ready to take your order - even if you are standing alone at the counter for five minutes while they make coffees and they are a foot away from you.  its unusual and unnerving. there is a strong clubby feel to the place; they are chummy with the regular "cool kids" and seemingly cold and aloof to everyone else (me, for example! i guess no one thinks social science grad students are cool).

they're also getting a bit too big for their britches. the lunch rush is a disaster. the atmosphere is very nice around mid morning.

i don't know. i keep going back after swearing its the last time. if i were more clever i'd make a hysterical and witty analogy to ex-girlfriends. why must you be so maddening, stable cafe?
author: Alex H.

description: I like the atmosphere of this place a great deal and the latte I'm drinking right now is good. A really good place to work for a few hours and the crowd is really relaxed. Outdoor seating is a big plus. Only problem is there are no power plugs. I would have stayed for lunch if I could get a couple more hours of life out of my laptop.
author: Zac w.

description: Expensive but yummy yummy yummy. The grilled veggie sandwich is huge and delicious and full of fresh, flavorful vegetables. I've never gotten the desserts/mufffins/cake slices but they look amazing. I usually get to-go, but it's a great, quite place to eat and work in/outdoors, too. I especially love that the kitchen is visible -- it reinforces the idea that the food is local and fresh. Perfect for lunch!
author: Mairead J.

description: I've been a fan of stable for weeks now, AND they open Saturdays now! (9-3 I think!??!) awesome. I super love this place.
author: ninja M.

description: It was rainy. It was last Sunday morning. I was not hung-over, not really..I needed coffee and a lil' sumthin' to go with. So there it is hip building - retro yet very modern co-loftly. One guy -one goatee - mumbled like one word - I think it was hi. Very Good DoubCappDry (always)  - my man got his usual cup o'joe - COLD! wow that's almost a first, geeze. The apple loaf or walnut cake slice was so fresh you could just imagine it's citrus & brown sugar cakeness in your bite - ahhh and sweet crust the kind you don't want to share. It was chilly in there if you are judging the singles and their crazy darting glances -  I'll be back on a Warm Sunny Day! (ha)
author: DoubleCappDry S.

description: I love the ambiance in this funky space.  The staff was very nice. My sandwich was very delish.  We sat outside in the warm Mission sun and everything was all good. I'm definitey going back.
author: Julia H.

description: wonderful place to get some sun and what may be the second best cappuccino in SF.  the food looks good and i will definitely be back to taste it.  nice location - easy to bike to.
author: Yevgenia F.

description: Nice Space, Really nice space for the neighborhood.  Staff wasn't super helpful, or really that nice at all.   The food was meh for the price.
author: Best M.

description:
this place literally has the BEST sandwiches around...i mean, seriously.  all the ingredients are EXTREMELY fresh, the seasonings and meat/veggie/cheese combos are unbeatable, and the bread...mmmm!

yes, this place is absolutely fantastic.  i can't say i've had a more satisfying lunch than i have from here.  not to mention, the ambiance is wonderful also; and the staff is so kind.  they really make an effort to know your name and make conversation.  you can tell they enjoy their job.
author: Melody H.

description:
2.75 stars

Ambiance is great. High, wooden-beam ceilings, huge street front windows, outdoor seating patio, upstairs seating.

Generous 'cup' of soup for about $4- it was a small bowl, with two lovely crostini. Beautiful dishes, nicely presented. Mushroom and potato soup, freshly made.

The counterperson gave me attitude when I asked for water and shrugged toward a pitcher on the sideboard. French much? Did I need your attitude?

Minuses- uncomfortable wooden seats. Carrying your own soup up a flight of stairs when you're pregnant. Hot as hell that Fri afternoon in the Mission- it was almost hotter inside than outside when I left, despite the doors being open.

Don't park on the north side of 18th St. after 4pm on a weekday. My friend kept on talking and I came back at 4:17 to no car. Luckily he drove me to the towing pickup on Harrison, but it was a $500 drag, including the parking ticket.
author: KD D.

description: I have wanted to try this place for months now. They have a quaint hip urban feel with a dog friendly side porch. I could read there for hours on a sunny day...very comfortable. The kitchen is spotless! I wish they would expand the hours and I would be a dedicated customer. I didn't try the food but it looks amazing. They sold me on their iced coffee and cookie. The service is a little slow but the quality, cleanliness and atmosphere more than make up for it.
author: J J.

description: Small, clean, hip, nicely remodeled.  Also the service is a bit slow, but I don't care.  -1 star for not being open after 4pm, when I often need coffee the most.  This side of the neighborhood needs more places like this.
author: Michael M.

description: After driving by this place more times than I can remember, I decided to try it out.  It's a fantastic little space in a funky area.  I wish this place was here 10 years ago when I lived in the area.  Food was good, I had the soup of the day (potato leek) and panini.  Soup was great, the panini was a little dry for my taste, but it was competent.   A nice space to hang out in; I say check it out.
author: Timothy W.

description:
If there was a way to give Stable zero stars, I would. Unbelievable attitude. The place looks lovely, but if you want the service befitting a paying customer, the joke's on you. My husband and I walked in on a Sunday late morning, happy to find a nice place in an area lacking in cafes, while we waited for our daughter at ODC Dance.
After standing there waiting while the two NOT busy waitpeople finished their chat, we ordered two decafe French presses, perhaps to order more. We were informed quite rudely that they had no decafe, and then the young woman proceeded to add a snarky remark that they believe in caffeine. Fine, no decafe, but why the attitude? 
Suffice to say, we won't be back. ODC will be opening a cafe at their new digs at Shotwell and 17 and they will get my business.
On Monday through Friday  (closed weekends) try Kafe 99 sq ft. (18th and Treat). I got there one evening at 5 pm as they were closing. They were lovely and graciously made me a decafe Americano, with a smile. No place to sit, but great coffee. Forget Stable, unless you love being treated like dirt.
author: Wendy R.

description: cute and delicious. the chicken sandwich was excellent and the dont over sweeten their chai
author: S M.

description: The food here-- on ingredient quality alone-- is simply better than almost anyone in the area in a competing price range. It's just ridiculous, actually, and makes me wonder what other folks are doing wrong.
author: Matt F.

description: Great, friendly staff.  Cool, clean vibe.  Try the lavender sea salt shortbread and a cup of hot green tea.  Perfect treat for the middle of the afternoon.  One of my favorite cafes in the City.
author: Nicki B.

description:
came here too early because they had a limited menu displayed. 

i very much enjoyed the 'piaf', which is egg on top of brie and tomato - baked. it's really yummy. [i want one right now.]

kim recommended to have lunch here during the week; they have great specials, but they close early. i guess i'll never try it because the only time i work is only on weekdays, business hours. boo.
author: Rosalee C.

description: Super cool venue - came here for Baracktoberfest last week and had a great time.  Giant side outdoor space that hosted a Santana taco truck, kegs and a human beatbox.  I'll definitely come back for beer/food once Barack takes office in November and we can all breathe easy.
author: Matt S.

description: Another great Mission coffee shop. Reasonable prices, crowded during lunch. The atmosphere is quite cozy - set in a high ceiling, big windowed, western wooden style building. Besides the coffee, the reason to go to a coffee shop is to enjoy the cozy atmosphere - and they have it!
author: Matt D.

description: Nice and chill with friendly service. Went with a recommendation from the friendly guy behind the counter (Matt??) Had the quinoa salad which was fantastic  - light AND filling. Will go back if I'm around when it's open. Wish them all the best and will definitely be back when they start opening in the evenings with their beer and wine license.
author: Anuj N.

description: Cute coffee shop with small but delicious menu. I always order the chicken foccacia bread sandwich. The ingredients just blend together so well. It is served with a wonderful salad. Small indoor seating, nice outdoor seating.
author: julie q.

description: came here for breakfast while visiting sf.  good menu selection and the 2 options my friend and i ordered were both very good, awesome outdoor seating area.  love that they offer french press coffee but it had an unusual after taste and they also press it beforehand and leave it in a thermos.  not sure how fresh it was.  good prices, $5-$8 for most breakfast options.
author: Jenna T.

description: I work in the same building as Stable so I end up going there almost every morning and it makes my day better. I need more meat options besides just bacon! I still give you 5 stars!!!
author: tim s.

description: Yum, I wanted to take the chef home with for the night, it was that good. I had this potato/cheese soup to die for.  The only thing I'd change about them is the hours, I'm rarely in the mission area before 3pm, on those rare occasions, Stable Cafe is my #1 stop for something delicious. It would be great if they would stay open later or have evening hours occasionally, I'd definetly would stop there on the way home.
author: Julie W.

description: On the recommendation of fellow Yelpers, I tried the lavender and sea salt shortbread cookie, which was delicious.  My latte was great too.   I love the inventive menu and I love that it is around the corner from work.  No longer will I be running to Peet's for my coffee break!
author: Kat W.

description: food was better than i might have guessed and the outdoor eating area (dog-friendly) was fantastic on the sunny day.
author: Victory V.

description: passed by this place a thousand times but finally made it in.  this place was a nice cozy place out of the rain.  not packed with overpretentious and badly dressed hipsters (bonus).  good coffee but served in small glass, limited brunch menu, but spacious including an upstairs with stools.  small selection of bagels but kudos for non-cream cheese options!
author: Kat R.

description: it's actually a casual and friendly place that you can meet up for brunch with almost anyone. i was able to park my bike nearby and had an awesome egg breakfast sandwich with a soy latte. a calm and peaceful place off the grid, if that interests you.
author: Connie H.

description: i love the space with all the natural light. great arugula salad after terrible breakfast earlier at another establishment. no problem with the service. lots of kids for some reason (not used to this in SF)
author: Helen K.

description: yay for converting an old building and taking a chance on folsom st.  the space looks amazing and the coffee is good.  just one less star for lack of comfortable seating...
author: mission girl g.

description: I expected something more, based on the reviews I've seen here. Decent, but overpriced food. Certainly nothing special, probably equivalent in quality to a place like Crepevine. The service was also slow and poor.  Will not return.
author: F G.

description: Great place but what's with the crappy brand of yogurt?  Total miss on that one.  Fix that and it's 5 stars. Stick with that and it shows local, organic and sustainable values aren't universal.
author: Chris A.

description: omg fig and goat cheese on focaccia nom nom nom.
author: Alyssa R.

description: Such a pretty place.  An old refurbished stable from something like 1859.  The coffee was pretty darn good (cappuccino), the roasted veggie sandwich was cold but really good, the biscotti was ok (i'm kinda picky about my biscotti but enjoy most any except i really hate starbucks but that's just another reason not to go so it doesn't much affect me, ...anyways... sorry for diversion...), i just can't call it great biscotti, although it's huge if you're all about size which some are but i think it's overrated, and i guess i like the crunchier ones better, too.  But aside from that ongoing meaningless diversion, i'll just conclude it's a really nice place to sit and get food and coffee or tea.  Plus, they have wifi and it's not just a laptop kinda coffee place, so it's a nice blend of laptops and people eating/talking, AND and they rent out kitchen space and a gallery party space (with or without the kitchen space i think) and with attached garden party space.  Pretty nice.  Cool place to check out now and then, a nice place to take people to lunch to i'd say.
author: Today Y.
